characters: INSIDE A MAXWELL HOUSE COFFEE CAN

dialogues.speaker: ON A "MAROON CARTOON"
dialogues.text: Accompanied by zany CARTOON MUSIC, the TITLE CARD reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below are two cameos of the cartoon's stars.  One picture of a cherubic baby in a bonnet innocently posed with his thumb in his mouth.  The other is of a paunchy rabbit wit gap between his front teeth.  He has a loveable, if sligh shell-shocked look.  The cartoon begins...

dialogues.speaker: BABY HERMAN AND ROGER RABBIT
dialogues.text: are in a playpen when TWO FEMALE LEGS in high heels walk FRAME.  The VOICE belonging to the legs talks down to Bab Herman in a maternal coo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy's going to the beauty parlor, darling.  But I'm leaving you with your favorite friend, Roger.  He's going to take very, very good care of you... (voice turns ominous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... cause if he doesn't, he's going back to the science lab! Roger gulps as he watches the legs disappear.  We HEAR FOOTSTEPS recede and a DOOR SLAM.  Roger turns confidentl back to his charge.  But the little tyke is already squee through the playpen bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby bye-bye... Roger makes a dive for him, misses, and gets his head stu between the bars.  He pleads with the Baby in a voice tha resonates of Huntz Hall in "The Bowery Boys".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come back!  You heard what your mother said!

dialogues.speaker: BABY HERMAN
dialogues.text: ignores Roger.  We FOLLOW HIM as he crawls into the kitch He stops to regard something that has caught his attentio a cookie jar.  It's sitting on top of the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coo-kie.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: wearing the playpen like a pillory, comes running toward kitchen.  But the playpen is too wide to clear the door. impact SHATTERING the playpen and sends Roger sprawling across the kitchen floor.  When he looks up...

dialogues.speaker: BABY HERMAN
dialogues.text: is swinging precariously on the door of the freeer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, Baby.  I'll save you! Roger makes a desperate leap across the kitchen for the k But Baby Herman swings the door to the freezer open and R disappears inside.  Baby Herman grabs a cookie and swings back, shutting the door.  He climbs down and crawls out o the kitchen.  After a beat, the freezer door opens.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: now shaped like a block of ice, falls out and hits the fl The block SHATTERS into ice cubes.  Roger looks around, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: BABY HERMAN
dialogues.text: has taken this opportunity to crawl out the window.  Roge races to the window.  His eyes pop out of his head at wha sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Herman is crawling along the sidewalk under the shad of a safe being hoisted into a second floor window by the Acme Safe Moving Company.  The rope holding the safe is fraying down to a slender thread.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: gasps and rockets out the window toward Baby Herman.  The rope snaps.  The safe falls.  Roger arrives just in time pluck the Baby out of harm's way.  But not in time to sav himself.  The safe CRUNCHES down on his head, burying Rog into the sidewalk.  After a beat, Roger's hand appears an spins the tumbler.  The safe door opens.  Inside, we see dazed rabbit with little TWEETING BIRDS circling his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut, cut, cut! The cartoon action stops abruptly, but the goofy CARTOON MUSIC PLAYS ON.  We begin a slow PULL BACK TO REVEAL that this cartoon is being filmed LIVE ON A SOUND STAGE.  The title card sits on an easle.  The female legs are paper mache' props manipulated by two HUMAN CREW MEMBERS.  Wear they lean the legs up against the stage wall.  A human DIRECTOR, wearing a tweed jacket and baggy pleated pants, steps onto the set.  From the equipment and the dress of crew, we can tell it's the 1940's.  Baby Herman throws hi cookie down in disgust.  He talks in a gravelly voice an octave lower than Wallace Beery's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was wrong with that take??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' with you, Baby Herman.  It's on Roger... again! (over shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Could we lose the playback? The MUSIC suddenly STOPS as, off to the side, the SOUNDMA lifts the needle off a phonograph record.  The Director l over Roger and angrily plucks one of the birds circling h head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this, Roger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tweeting bird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, a tweeting bird.  But what does the script say?  'Rabbit gets conked.  Rabbit sees stars!'  Not birds, stars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, for cryin' out loud, Roger!  I'll be in my trailer... takin' a nap! Baby Herman pulls himself up to his full height of two fe and walks off the set.  He chooses a route that takes him under the dress of the SCRIPT GIRL.  She jumps as if goos Now two CREW MEMBERS lift the safe off Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Raoul.  I can give you stars, I know I can.  Just drop the safe on my head one more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already dropped it on you twenty-three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me.  I can take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not worried about you.  I'm worried about the safe. CONTINUED PULLBACK. What we've been seeing has been from the POV of a MAN in shiny brown suit standing unobtrusively at the back of th sound stage.  Under a beat-up fedora is a craggy face tha seen a lot in its life... but apparently didn't think muc it was funny.  EDDIE VALIANT takes a jolt from a pint of whiskey, evidently in reaction to what he's seen.  He ope his coat and returns the pint bottle to a shoulder holste which had formerly held a .38.  Nerves steadied, he walks the stage door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant emerges from the stage onto a bustling Hollywood studio lot where CARTOON CHARACTERS (TOONS) and humans ar comingling as if it were the most natural thing in the wo Valiant stops by an Acme Novelty truck which is unloading Toon props.  There are bombs, rockets, flattened pocket watches, anvils, giant slingshots, etcetera.  The license plate is California 1946.  He fishes out a pack of Chesterfields and taps out a half a butt that had been stubbed out.  As he lights it, Valiant regards a chubby, balding man wearing a three-piece suit and a worried expression coming towards him.  He is R.K. MAROON, studio boss.  Maroon is leading an entourage of ASSISTANTS tryin keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting tomorrow there'll be no more roast beef lunches.  What happened to cheese sandwiches?  I was raised on cheese sandwiches. As the Assistants dutifully record his thoughts, Maroon s a GUY taking a nap in the shade of a palm tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tell that guy sleepin' over there he's fired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your wife's brother, R.K.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reconsiders)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... tell him he's promoted.  But get him out of my sight. As the Assistants disperse, Maroon approaches Valiant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant, did you see the rabbit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was blowin' his lines, all right. So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?  He's already put me three weeks behind on the shooting schedule! Now an EDITH HEAD-TYPE hustles up to show Maroon several costume designs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your reaction, R.K.? Maroon quickly checks out the drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  That's not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flips another drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny.  Put a homburg on him it'll even be funnier.  Huh, Valiant? He grabs the pad and shows Valiant.  The rendering is of hippo in a pink polka-dot tu-tu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that'd be a riot. Maroon responds to Valiant's sarcasm with raised eyebrows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I hope what you have ain't contagious or I'll be out of business. He hands the pad back to the designer, who departs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you know about show business, Valiant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only there's no business like it, no business I know. Valiant watches an ALLIGATOR in a rebel uniform dragging brace of cannons and several TOADSTOOLS parade by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and there's no business as expensive.  I'm twenty-five grand over budget on the latest Bunnysitter cartoon and it's all because that rabbit can't keep his mind on his work. And you know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One too many safes dropped on his head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, that goes with the territory. He's a stunt bunny. Maroon takes a copy of the "Hollywood Tattler" out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the problem... (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Seen cooing over calamari with notsonew Sugar Daddy was Jessica Rabbit... wife of Maroon star, Roger". (looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife's a tramp, but he thinks she's Betty Crocker.  The doubt's eatin' him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a couple juicy pictures. Somethin' I can wise the rabbit up with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't work in Toontown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to.  The rabbit's wife sings at an underground Toon revue joint called The Ink & Paint Club.  You can catch her in action there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The job's gonna cost you a hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred bucks?  That's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's the job. Valiant starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right... You got your hundred bucks. Maroon turns, snaps his fingers.  His Assistant appears o of nowhere with Maroon's checkbook and a pen.  The Assist turns and stoops so that Maroon can write the check on hi back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty now, fifty when you deliver the pictures. Maroon tears the check off and hands it to Valiant.  Sudd Valiant ducks in reflex to a large shadow that passes overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda jumpy aren't you, Valiant?  It's just Dumbo.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THEIR HEADS
dialogues.text: swoops back and forth, then hovers, ears flapping like a hummingbird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him on loan from Disney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you the lucky one... Valiant grabs the check from Maroon and starts for the ga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will I hear from you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as is humanly possible. We FOLLOW Valiant out the gate under a wrought iron sign reads "Maroon Cartoon Studios".  As he starts across the he's almost run over by a Toon roadster that ROARS out of gates.  When it BLASTS ITS HORN, it's the FIRST FIVE NOTE from the WOODY WOODPECKER SONG:  "HA-HA-HA-HA-HA".  Valia jumps back as the roadster passes.  WOODY THE WOODPECKER' behind the wheel with a self-important smile on his face. Valiant angrily waves the cloud of Toon dust away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn Toons.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: is slowing to a stop in front of the studio.  It's a Paci and Electric "Red Car", part of a vast system of electric trollies that once criss-crossed the L.A. Basin.  Valiant steps onto the "Red Car".  He reaches into his pocket to the CONDUCTOR his nickel fare.  But he comes up with a handful of lint.  He holds out the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I look like, a bank? The Conductor jerks his thumb toward the door.  Valiant suffers the public humiliation,of having to step down pas the rest of the boarding passengers.  He walks around to back of the Red Car where a gang of TEN-YEAR-OLDS are loitering.  When the BELL SOUNDS and the Red Car starts t pull away, the Kids make a dash for a place on the cow catcher.  Valiant joins them.  We HOLD as the Red Car mov away and the street urchins regard their older partner in crime with curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: A BILLBOARD SIGN
dialogues.text: It reads:  "L.A.'s Pacific and Electric Red Car -- Americ Finest Public Transportation System".  PAN DOWN to see th the sign is on the roof of the trolley terminal.  Red Car are going in and out of the shed.  MOVE IN on one car approaching the terminal from down the street.  As it pas by...

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: hops off his freeloader's seat on the back,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, mister. Valiant waves laconically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the cigarettes. We FOLLOW Valiant as he crosses the street to a seedy bungalow.  A note is push-pinned to the door.

dialogues.speaker: NOTE
dialogues.text: It says:  "Tomorrow's Friday... Well?  Dolores".

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: takes the note and walks back across the street toward th terminal.  He climbs up a flight of stairs, heading for a on the mezzanine.  The bar sports a red neon sign that us to blink, "The Terminal Station Bar".  But now it just sa "Terminal".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place must have been pretty swanky at the turn of the century when it was built in the first burst of enthusias over the new public transportation system.  It's in the m of a trolley car.  There's a large map on the wail above bar showing all the different lines.  Behind the bar is DOLORES.  If you scraped off all the makeup, you'd find a attractive woman in her late thirties.  She ministers to rag-tag assortment of Hollywood low-lifes -- who are trul the end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: enters this den, lets his eyes adjust for a moment, then bellies up to the bar.  He finds a spot between a ONE-ARM BLACK SOLDIER and a MIDGET stretched out on the bar passe out.  Now a TROLLEY RUMBLES underneath them.  The bar sta to shake like an earthquake, the lights flicker.  All the drinkers, observing a time honored ritual, lift their gla simultaneously to avoid spilling any drops.  Even the Mid lifts his head until the trolley has passed.  Valiant rea over the bar and blind-grabs a bottle of rye he obviously knows is there.  He pours himself a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fellas, what's the good word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost my job. An ARTHRITIC COWBOY pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mule died. A DEAF-MUTE scribbles a note on a pad hanging around his neck.  He hands the note to Valiant.  It says "My girl du me".  Valiant pats him on the back, consoling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know what they say about dames, Augie... Then Valiant mouths the rest of it for Augie's benefit on Augie reads his lips, then starts to roar silently, slapp his thigh.  Now Dolores makes her way down the bar.  She grabs the Midget by the suspenders and slides him out of way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, makin' dame jokes, huh, Eddie? Well, lemme remind ya pal, it was a dame who took a hundred bucks out of the till so your landlord would't throw you out of your dump.  And it was a dame who trusted you for the money when no one else in town would.  And it's a dame who's tired of waitin' for you to straighten yourself out and get a job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would this be the same dame who's going to feel awfully foolish when she finds out I've got her money. Valiant slides the check across the bar.  Dolores studies She calms down a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fifty bucks.  I need seventy-five before they check the books tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have it in the morning.  Now be a sport and lemme have twenty bucks to put in my pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this paper even good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the scrawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R.K. Maroon. Now ANGELO, a Neanderthal sitting a few stools down, is tapping the shell of a hardboiled egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maroon?  Valiant, don't tell me you're workin' for a Toon?  Who's your client? Chilly Willy or Screwy Squirrel? Angelo chuckles at his own joke and goes to eat his egg. Suddenly Valiant darkens.  He grabs Angelo by the shirt a pulls him up to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this straight, greaseball.  I'm not workin' for a Toon!  I'd never work for a Toon!  Got that? Valiant jams the whole egg into Angelo's mouth, turns and storms out the door.  Angelo sputters and spits out the e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toon killed his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant knocks on the door of, a non-descript building in run-down factory area.  A speakeasy style peephole slides open REVEALING the face of a TOON GORILLA.  Valiant offer the password.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walt sent me. The peephole slides closed and after a beat the door swin open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gorilla, dressed in a tux, gives Valiant the once ove Valiant resents the assessment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like your monkey suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wise ass... We FOLLOW Valiant down the hall toward the main room.  We HEAR LAUGHTER and ZANY MUSIC from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Valiant steps through the doorway, we see the place no dive.  It's a white tablecloth nightclub on a par with El Morroco or the Garden of Allah.  Behind the bar A CATERPILLAR BARTENDER is using his many arms to shake and pour several drinks at once.  Meanwhile a dozen PENGUIN WAITERS are gliding back and forth along the tables servi drinks to the well-heeled crowd.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: DONALD DUCK and DAFFY DUCK are seated opposite each other matching grand pianos.  What begins as a decorous Duck du on a Tchaikovsky piece (complete with knuckle-cracking, seat-spinning preparations) quickly accelerates to a loon game of one-upsmanship between these two irascible Ducks. There is keyboard stomping, lid-banging, piano wire pluck zaniness.

dialogues.speaker: THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: is HOWLING.  People are wiping the tears from their eyes they're laughing so hard.  All except...

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: He lights a cigarette impassively, not humored by the Too hijinx.  He spots an empty table off to the side and make his way towards it.  A SILLY GEEZER in a loud suit is at next table.  The Geezer nods to him soberly as Valiant pu Out the chair and sits down.  A LOUD FLATULENCE SOUND eru from under Valiant.  The Geezer slaps his thigh with the hilarity of it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you listen to that?  It's a pip! I'm thinking of callin' it a Whoopee Cushion. Valiant reaches under himself and comes up holding a defl rubber bladder.  The Geezer retrieves it from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No hard feelings, I hope.  Put 'er there... The Geezer grabs Valiant's hand before he can say no.  We HEAR A BUZZ.  Valiant retracts his hand as if shocked.  T Geezer howls with laughter and turns his palm to Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand buzzer... real gasser. Valiant rolls his eyes and grabs a Penguin as it glides b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a two drink minimum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as long as there's no maximum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiter, I'll sign my check now. The Penguin puts a bill down on the Geezer's table and zi off.  The Geezer takes a fountain pen out of his jacket a writes on the bill.  But there doesn't seem to be any ink coming out.  He shakes and shakes the pen to get it flowi It flows all right.  Ink splatters all over Valiant's shi and pants.  Valiant looks down at the stain, doing a slow burn.  The Geezer starts laughing.  Valiant jumps up and grabs him by the lapels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it for you, pops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, son.  Look, the ink is gone. Valiant looks down at his shirt.  The stain is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?  It disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why don't you make like the ink? Valiant drops him into his chair and returns to his seat. The Penguin glides up with his drinks.  Valiant swallows first one with one quick jerk of the head.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Donald and Daffy's PIANO COMPETITION has reached a CRESCE of mayhem.  They've got the axes out, and in time with th MUSIC they reduce their pianos to matchsticks.  At the completion of the piece, they step to the front of the st and with great decorum, arms around each other, they take their bows.  The curtain comes down to GREAT APPLAUSE.  W HEAR SFX of CRASHING AND BASHING backstage.  Now from beh Valiant, we HEAR a familiar high-pitched VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cigars... cigarettes... Eddie? Valiant turns to see BETTY BOOP standing with a box of tobacco wares strapped around her neck.  In contrast to a the other Toons, Betty's in black and white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, it's swell to see you, Eddie.  We miss you in Toontown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish I could say the same.  What're you doin' here, Betty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work's been slow for me since the cartoons went to color.  But I still got it, Eddie... (sings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Boop boop be-doop'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you still got it, Betty. (indicates Geezer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Mr. Jocularity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leans in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Marvin Acme, the gag king.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda guessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes here every night to see Jessica Rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big on the musical comedy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you ve never seen her, Eddie. Now the lights dim and Betty moves on.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: the dour DROOPY walks out with the spotlight following hi He's the evening's emcee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, everybody.  I hope you're all having as much fun as I am.  I have a small announcement to make.  Jessica Rabbit will not be able to sing tonight. There's a ROAR OF DISAPPROVAL from the men in the crowd. They shower him with debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; deadpan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was merely jesting.  Without further ado... here's woman times two, Toontown's own chanteuse par excellance... Jessica Rabbit! There is excited APPLAUSE as the lights dim. A TOON COMBO made up of CROWS in shades STRIKES UP the intro to the sm song, "Why Don't You Do Right".  A spotlight hits the curtain. Now a curvaceous leg pokes out, teasingly.  The crowd goes wild as the rest of the body belonging to the emerges.  JESSICA RABBIT is a generously endowed red-head bombshell.  She's a humanoid Toon... in her case, more beautiful than human.  Her figure is testimony to what a can do with a pencil and a fertile imagination,

dialogues.speaker: REACTION
dialogues.text: This is not quite the bunny he expected Roger to be marri to.  His jaw drops.  And his reaction is mirrored all aro the room.  The men are panting so hard you couldn't keep match lit.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: as she steps to the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'You had plenty of money back in '22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let other woman make a fool of you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you do right. Like some other men do... Get out of here and Get me the money too...' Jessica takes the mike and comes off the stage.  Slinkily she wanders among the tables, teasing the men as she goes Now there's a HOWL from behind Valiant.  A Tex Avery type TOON WOLF, who came masquerading as a human, couldn't hel but show his true colors at the sight of Jessica.  He HOW as if it were a full moon.  His tongue rolls out of his h and piles up on the floor like so much clothesline.  His eyeballs telescope out of his head.  And finally, the Wol levitates and snaps rigid like an open jacknife.  As the makes a rush for the stage, the Gorilla Bouncer grabs him the suspenders.  The Wolf, legs spinning madly, practical knocks Valiant's table over as he grabs at Jessica.  But Wolf has come to the end of his suspenders.  He snaps bac toward the Gorilla who is holding an anvil in front of th suspenders.  CLANG!  The Wolf hits the anvil and slides t the floor.  The Gorilla calmly whisks him into a dustpan carries him out.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: like all good saloon singers, has continued her act undaunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Why don't you do right. Like some other men do...' She sashays over to the Geezer's table.  Teasingly, she swirls the whisps of white hair onto his head into a Dair Queen.  He giggles gleefully and makes a grab at Jessica. But she slips out of his grasp like mercury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'You ain't got no money Ain't got no use for you...' Now Jessica works her way over to Eddie.  She stops at hi table and sings tauntingly.  Then with a flourish, she th herself in his lap, and belts out the finale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'So get out of here... And get me the money toooo!' There is RAUCOUS APPLAUSE when she finishes.  Jessica loo deep into Eddie's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your lap. Before Eddie can reply, she jumps off, and slinks offstag leaving Eddie a pile of human wreckage.  Valiant slugs th rest of his drink down to put out the fire in his libido. When the lights come up, Valiant looks over to where Acme slicking down his eyebrows and patting his hair down.  He stands, picks up a bouquet of roses from the chair beside him, and as he passes Valiant's table, gives him a big wi Valiant watches Acme disappear backstage.  He stands, dro a couple bucks on the table, and follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Valiant steps past the curtain, keeping a discreet distan He follows Marvin Acme down a corridor and around the cor Acme stops and knocks on a dressing room door.  After a moment, it opens and Acme goes inside.  Valiant checks ov his shoulder, but the backstage area is empty.  He eases to the door and puts his eye to the keyhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica is seated at her dressing table.  Acme is on his knees next to her, kissing his way up her gloved hand, ey closed in ecstasy.  Jessica takes her hand out of the glo and starts combing her hair, leaving Marvin kissing a suspended Toon glove.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: while he continues his peeping.  The Gorilla bouncer snea up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, whaddaya think you're doin', chump?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who're you callin' chump, chimp? The Gorilla smiles sadistically when he recognizes Valian

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's da comedian... The Gorilla grabs Valiant by the belt and lifts him off t ground.  He opens the fire door and heaves Valiant out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant comes flying out the door and CRASHES into a bunc garbage cans in the alley.  The Gorilla stands in the doo regarding the dazed Valiant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't lemme catch your peepin' face around here again.  Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooga-booga. The Gorilla slams the door.  Valiant picks himself up out the garbage.  He brushes himself off, then starts down th alley toward the rear of the building.  We FOLLOW him aro the corner where he stops under Jessica's dressing room window.  He drags over a milk crate to stand on, takes a small camera out of his pocket and opens the bellows.  He stands on the crate and aims the camera through the corne the window, as we HEAR the MUFFLED CONVERSATION from with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to play pattycake tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin, I have a headache...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you promised...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, all right.  But this time take that hand buzzer off... Valiant's eyes widen in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... As he starts CLICKING pictures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one light on in the Administration building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a large art deco office with walls covered with phot of Maroon and various celebrities, human and Toon.  R.K. Maroon is seated behind his desk.  Standing nearby is Valiant.  They are both regarding a hysterical Roger Rabb who's holding a set of 8 x lO glossies.  He's WAILING and CRYING, Toon tears flooding off him in a torrent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pattycake!  Pattycake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baker's man... but no use ruinin' a good pair of shoes over it.

dialogues.speaker: RUG
dialogues.text: Roger's tears have formed a puddle around the desk.  Vali lifts a well-worn oxford and shakes the water off it.

dialogues.speaker: MAROON
dialogues.text: hands Roger his handkerchief.  Roger AAH-OO-GA'S his nose

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take comfort, son, you're not the first man whose wife played pattycake on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.  I won't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pictures don't lie.  Mr. Valiant here took them himself. Roger takes another look at the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOS
dialogues.text: They're shots of Jessica Rabbit and Marvin Acme seated kn to knee, caught in the act of slapping palms... really playing pattycake.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Maroon gets up and crosses to a bar table set up by the window.  He pours a drink from a crystal decanter as Roge starts sobbing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jessy... she's the light of my life, the apple of my eye, the cream in my coffee... Valiant eyes the booze longingly as he mutters to himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you better start thinkin' about drinkin' it black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, I'm shocked.  Marvin Acme's been my friend and neighbor for thirty years. Maroon gestures out the window.  We see a blinking neon s on the roof of the building across the street -- "Acme - It's Acme - It's A Gasser!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would have thought he was the Sugar Daddy? Maroon turns and carries the drink to Roger.  Meanwhile, Valiant sidles over to the bar to help himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the important thing now Roger, is to put all this behind you. (hands him drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink this, son, you'll feel better. Roger takes the glass and shoots it down in one gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this all seems painful now, but you'll find someone new.  Won't he, Mr, Valiant? Eddie has just picked up the decanter to pour one for himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.  Good lookin' guy like him. Dames'll be breakin' his door down.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: The booze is taking its effect.  There's a RUMBLE like a volcano about to erupt.  Suddenly Roger's head turns into Toon steam whistle SHRIEKING.  The HIGH PITCH causes glas objects in the room to SHATTER... including the crystal decanter that Valiant's holding in his hand.  It EXPLODES soaking his suit with booze.  Valiant looks down at the damage, completely exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-bitch... (turns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Maroon, I think I'll be goin' now, so about the rest of my fee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Valiant, sure... Maroon sits at the desk and writes a check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being experienced in these matrimonial matters, you have any advice for our friend here? Valiant crosses to the desk and takes the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My advice?  Hop on over to Reno, get yourself a quickie divorce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divorce?  Never! Suddenly Roger jumps onto Maroon's desk and grabs Valiant the lapels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marriage is a two-way street and we're just experiencing a detour!  Jessica and I are going to get back together. We're going to be happy!   H-A-P-P-I! Roger zips off the desk and CRASHES out the window, leavi rabbit outline in the glass... backlit by the blinking Ac sign.  Maroon and Valiant walk to the window and look out rabbit-shaped hole in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least he took it well.

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: PULL BACK TO REVEAL the bottle's on the floor next to the couch Valiant's passed out on.  He's still dressed in his clothes.  PAN the small studio apartment.  In the kitchen/alcove, Valiant has created a makeshift darkroom. see a curtain on a clothesline.  Various trays, and some pictures clipped up on clothespins.  The pictures depict Jessica Rabbit and Marvin Acme in various states of pattycake.  Now there is LOUD POUNDING on the door.  But doesn't break through VaLiant's subconscious for several seconds.  Finally, he rouses, gets up and walks a crooked line to the door.  Valiant opens it and squints into the excruciating sunlight.  When his eyes focus, REVEAL a hang-dog POLICE DETECTIVE holding Eddie's morning paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Santino... how ya doin'? Santino ignores the question and regards Valiant with a mixture of disgust and pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you didn't do a snoop job for a Toon named Roger the Rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you woke me up for? Santino flops open the morning paper.  Valiant's eyes nar as he reads it.  The headline screams:  "TOON KILLS MAN!" underneath:  "Marvin Acme Murdered at the Hands of Jealou Rabbit".  Santino throws the paper on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got trouble, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An L.A. police car turns into the yard of the Acme factor and pulls up in front of the old factory building.  There all kinds of official activity in the yard... cop cars, a Coroner's truck, etcetera. Valiant and Santino get out of the police car.  Santino starts into the factory.  But he realizes Valiant's not following him.  He turns to see Valiant looking over the behind the factory, transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just haven't been this close to Toontown for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky above the wall is a different color, a little bit more vibrant, a "Toon Blue", you might call it.

dialogues.speaker: SANTINO
dialogues.text: walks back and takes Valiant's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, somebody wants to see you. Santino leads Valiant into the factory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a large warehouse filled with stacks of Toon gags,.. boxes of dynamite, giant slingshots, boulders, everything you've ever seen in a Roadrunner cartoon.  Santino stops where a large black safe is imbedded at a cockeyed angle the floor.  A FORENSIC TEAM is at work around the safe. They're chalking the outline around a body half obscured the safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say the rabbit got the safe idea from a cartoon he was makin' the other day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a gasser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here... Santino walks to Acme's glassed office where a sobbing Jessica Rabbit is being interrogated.  We can only see he not the person doing the interrogating.  Valiant sidles o to where the Forensic Guys are dusting the photographs he taken for prints.  One of the Forensic Guys looks up from work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, didn't you used to be Eddie Valiant? Valiant ignores the slings and arrows and surveys the sce of the crime.  The door of the safe is ajar.  Valiant tri to look inside.  Forensic #2 closes the door with his kne Now we HEAR the VOICE of Jessica Rabbit from behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Valiant? Valiant turns to the voice.  WHAP!  Jessica slaps him har enough across the face to make his head turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're proud of yourself. She turns on her heel and storms off, sobbing into a handkerchief.  Valiant, rubbing his jaw, looks after her. do the Forensic Guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She likes you, Valiant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low wolf whistle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they drew her, they broke the pencil. Now two WHITE-JACKETS from the Coroner's office start to carry Acme out on a stretcher.  As they pass Valiant, a h still wearing a Hand Buzzer flops out.  Valiant grabs it stopping the stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes you wonder what in the world she was doin' with a guy who didn't clean his fingernails.

dialogues.speaker: HAND
dialogues.text: Imbedded under the fingernails is a reddish-brown substan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... it's blood.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: peels a piece of it off... it chips and falls to the grou He squats to examine it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not blood, it's paint. Suddenly the end of a cane comes down on Valiant's hand, pinning it to the floor.  Valiant follows the cane UP to gavel-shaped head -- past black pants, a black robe, to a cadaver-like complected face, and a large hooked probosci The head is shaved.  Rimless tinted glasses obscure the e Although he's human, the total appearance is frighteningl vulture-like.  JUDGE DOOM is accompanied by Santino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this man removing evidence from the scene of a crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deferential)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... no, Judge Doom.  Valiant here was just about to hand it over, weren't you, Valiant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that. Doom takes his cane off Eddie's hand and reaches out for paint chip.  Valiant palms a piece and drops a smaller pi into Doom's hand.  Doom examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the deceased grabbed a handful of your client's pantaloons, Mr. Valiant. Valiant stands to face the Judge, who towers over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not my client.  I was workin' for R.K. Maroon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we talked to Mr. Maroon.  He told us the rabbit became quite agitated when you showed him the pictures, and said nothing would stand in the way of him getting his wife back.  Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pal, do I look like a stenographer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth, Eddie, he's a judge. Doom smiles thinly at Valiant, tarns and walks with purpo towards the door.  Santino and Valiant follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rabbit's movements are fairly clear after leaving the Maroon Studios.  He ran across the street, jimmied this door open, hoisted the safe on a block and tackle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doom leads them outside and indicates a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... then stood out here waiting for his prey.  After he cold-bloodedly accomplished his task, he went home. He was almost apprehended there by my men. Doom nods his head toward a group of sinister WEASLES (a Disney's "Wind In The Willows").  They're loitering by a dogcatcher's wagon with "Toontown Control" on the side, cleaning their fingernails with switchblades and polishin Toon revolvers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men?  They look more like weasles to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I find that weasles have a special gift for the work. (turns back to Valiant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rabbit didn't contact you by any chance, did he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he contact me?  I just took some lousy pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you wouldn't have any idea where he might be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you tried Walla Walla?  Kokomo's very nice this time of year. Doom steps into Valiant's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised you aren't more cooperative, Mr. Valiant.  A human has been murdered by a Toon.  Don't you appreciate the magnitude of that?  My goal as Judge of Toontown, has been to rein in the insanity.  To bring a semblance of law and order to a place where no civilized person has ever been able to step foot. The only way to do that is to make the Toons respect the law. Suddenly a "YA-HA-HOOEY" interrupts his pontification, as scruffy little TOON GOPHER comes hurtling over the wall f the Toontown side.  He's holding his blackened rear end.. apparently the result of a run-in with a stick of dynamit BONK!  The Gopher hits Doom in the back of the head, send them both sprawling.  The Gopher picks himself up and sha off the effects of the concusion.  When he sees who he's knocked down, he panics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (petrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Doom!  Here, let me get that for ya. He whips a clothes brush out of his back pocket and furio tries to clean the Judge's cloak.  Doom picks up the Goph by the scruff of the neck and gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you filthy little vagrant, you've soiled my robe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cleanin' up real good. Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've defiled a symbol of justice. As Doom carries the Gopher to the "Toontown Control" wago Valiant shoots a look to Santino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd this gargoyle come from anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one knows.  He bought the election a few years back.  He's been rulin' Toontown ever since. When Doom gets to the wagon, the Weasles open up the back In place of steel bars is a stream of fluid.  A Weasle tu a key and the flow of liquid stops.  The Gopher starts kicking furiously, trying to avoid the lock-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, Judge, please, please, lemme go.  I think I hear my mother callin' me. Finally, the Gopher breaks free and makes a desperate das for the wall.  Doom watches him run and calmly turns to w his car is parked.  It's a black Lincoln touring car with ugly bird-like hood ornament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voltaire... the Gopher! Suddenly. the hood ornament SQUAWKS to life.  It's a hide TOON VULTURE.  The Vulture flaps into flight. Just as the Gopher is about to make it over the top of th wall the Vulture's talons sink into his rear end and lift airborne.  The Vulture drops the Gopher off with the Weas They pin him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't I have any rights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you do... to a swift and speedy trial. One of the Weasles retrieves a briefcase from the sedan, it on the hood and snaps it open.  Twelve TOON KANGAROOS up, arranged in a jury box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Court is now in session. He raps the Gopher on the head with the gavel end of his cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defendant is charged with vagrancy, assault and resisting arrest.  How do you find him? The Kangaroo court delivers the verdict instantly. Twelve LITTLE KANGAROOS pop up out of their Momma's pouches, hol up small cards, each with a letter spelling Y-O-U A-R-E G-U-I-L-T-Y.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty as charged.  Case closed! Doom slams the briefcase shut.  He turns his attention ba to the Gopher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hereby sentence you to the dip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, not the dip!  Anything but the dip!  I'm too young to die... As the Judge pulls on a black rubber glove, the Weasles t out a stainless steel tub WHEEZING with sadistic glee.  T fill it from a spigot on the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the dip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how he gets rid of the troublemakers.  It's a combination of acetone, turpentine and paint remover. He calls it the...  Final Solution.

dialogues.speaker: THE GOPHER
dialogues.text: is wriggling and SCREAMING bloody murder as Doom lifts hi and holds him over the tub.  Then, as he's lowered into t solution, he starts to disappear. His pathetic SCREAMS ar snuffed MID-YELP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!  Help!  He... The Gopher's gone.  All that's left of him is a paint sli on the surface of the liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Doom pulls off the black rubber gloves finger by finger a hands them to a Weasle.  He turns to Valiant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not kid gloves, Mr. Valiant. but that's how we handle things in Toontown.  I would think you'd appreciate that. He gets into his car, he pauses and looks back at Valiant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all, didn't a Toon kill your brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores is behind the bar cutting lemon peels and prepari for the day's bartending.  There's one early customer, a grey-haired TROLLEYMAN in his Red Car uniform.  His hat's the stool next to him and he's already drunk.  The door opens.  It's Valiant.  He walks over to the bar, reaches a bottle and a shot glass and helps himself.  Dolores pic up a copy of the morning paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Eddie, looks like you really stepped in it this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you complaining about?  Here's your fifty bucks. Valiant slides the check across the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five years and all I got to show for it is a ticket punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with Earl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new outfit bought the Red Car.  Some big company called Cloverleaf Industries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kiddin'?  Bought the Red Cars, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastards put him on notice. Valiant picks up his glass. lifts it in toast to the Trolleyman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's to the pencil pushers.  May they all get lead poisoning. Now the Trolleyman unsteadily climbs up on his stool to g close to the Holy Grail... the Red Car route map over the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old Number Six Line... who'da thought they'd close that one down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, get him down from there.  He's gonna break his neck. Eddie grabs Earl around the legs and throws him over his shoulder like a sack of potatoes.  He carries him over to booth and puts him down carefully, covering him with a tablecloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took you right to Toontown, it did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know... poor S.O.B. Valiant walks back to his drink at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think the rabbit did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna think.  I wanna drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make that a round. Valiant and Dolores look down the bar, but there's no one there.  Finally the familiar cowlick of Baby Herman rises the top of the bar as he clambers up a barstool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't serve formula. Snookums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You serve martinis, doncha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Baby Herman slides his baby bottle down the bar to Dolore

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it dry.  Baby doesn't like to be wet. (to Valiant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Valiant, right?  The name's Baby Herman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are.  Kinda out of your neighborhood, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I had to go slummin'.  See, a friend of mine's bein' framed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the rabbit?  They got him cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe that.  I mean. the guy's an idiot, a moron, a complete fool...  but he'd never kill anyone. I know the guy. Dolores brings Baby Herman his baby bottle cocktail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, doll. When Dolores turns around, Baby Herman pats her on the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, a ladies man, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto voce; to Valiant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My problem is I got a fifty-year-old lust and a three-year-old dinkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My problem is I come here to drink in peace.  So if you don't mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Valiant, doesn't this whole thing smell a bit funny to you?  I mean, no offense, but how did a mucky-muck like R.K. Maroon find you in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chiming in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Eddie, it's not like you got an ad in the Yellow Pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the vote of confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another thing, the paper said no will was found.  But every Toon knows Acme had a will and, in it he promised to leave Toontown to the Toons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is it then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody took it from him.  That's what this whole thing's about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The papers said the safe door was opened, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick to stuffin' the olives, willya, Dolores?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hunch is it was Maroon.  He always was after Acme's property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Does he wear pants this color? Valiant takes the paint chip out of his pocket and dangle in front of Baby Herman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But neither does Roger.  That's Diablo Red.  Roger's pants are Sunrise Orange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your next move, Valiant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My next move?  That's easy.  I'm gettin' up, and I'm walkin' out the door, and I'm goin' home to bed. Valiant stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're not even gonna bother to find out if the rabbit's gettin' framed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a Toon... who cares? Baby Herman shakes his head sorrowfully.  As Valiant head for the door, Dolores whaps her towel down on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you used to care, Eddie.  And it didn t matter if a client's skin was black, white, or painted! Valiant ignores her and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie comes in the door with his coat over his shoulder. tosses the jacket over the chair and walks to the Murphy He grabs the strap, and loosening his tie, walks away fro the wall, pulling the bed down.  What he doesn't see is..

dialogues.speaker: ROGER RABBIT
dialogues.text: asleep in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: still with his back to Roger, sits down exhaustedly on th bed and kicks off his shoes.  He lies back and pulls the covers over him.  He closes his eyes, rolls over to get comfortable.  Now he and Roger are nose-to-nose.  They bo open their eyes at the same time.  They freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aah! They both jump out of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed a place to hide.  I'm in trouble, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I hear.  Even talkin' to you could get me a rap for aiding and abetting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Eddie, no one knows I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?  Then how'd you find my house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I asked the newsboy on the corner.  He didn't know.  Then I asked a janitor, the fireman and finally the green grocer down the way.  He was very helpful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words, the whole goddamn world knows you're here!  Out!  Get out! Eddie tries to open the door, but Roger blocks it spider-like, arms and legs extended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Eddie, don't put me out.  I didn't do it, I swear. Valiant gives up trying to open the door and grabs Roger. pulls and he pulls.  Finally Roger snaps off like a broke rubber band.  The two of them go tumbling backward.  Vali makes a grab for Roger but he slips out of his grasp like quicksilver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I wanted to win Jessy back, but not that way. Valiant lunges again.  Roger dodges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After I left you, I went to see her at the Ink & Paint Club. Valiant picks himself up and tries to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was on stage, so I found a piece of paper and wrote her a love letter. Roger pulls a piece of paper out of his pocket and starts reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Dear Jessy.  How do I love thee?  Let me count the ways.  1-1000, 2-1000, 3-1000... Valiant leaps for Roger and gets bim by the throat.  He r the paper out of Roger's hand and crumples it up and thro it down.  He opens the door, throws Roger outside and qui slams the door shut.  He leans against it, breathing hard Suddenly, Roger comes through the mail slot like a limbo dancer.  Valiant, too tired to chase him, just watches hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that wasn't very nice. He retrieves the love letter, straightens it and puts it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took me almost an hour to compose that.  But I decided not to leave it anyway.  I'd read it in person, that was my plan. Valiant crosses to the kitchen area where the dark room i still set up.  He opens the cabinet under the sink and co out with a bottle of Scotch.  He takes a shot glass and p himself one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, pal, if you're still here when I finish this drink, I'm callin' the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that!  I'm innocent I tell ya. The police'll just dip me.  They were waitin' for me when I got home last night.  I ran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're so innocent, why'd you run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, Eddie, I'm a rabbit.  We always run. Valiant shoots the drink down and holds up the empty glas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. He crosses to the phone on the counter.  He lifts the receiver and starts to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is the moment of truth!  And I've spoken the truth, but you won't believe the truth.  So I guess the truth is my goose is cooked, my hash is slung. my fait is accompli. As Valiant finishes dialing, he idly puts the empty shot glass down on a photograph on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't anything change your mind? Valiant turns from the pleading rabbit.  Now something he sees on the counter gets his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shot glass is resting on one of the reject pictures o Acme and Jessica.  The bottom of the glass is magnifying back of the exuberant Marvin Acme.  Sticking out of his b pocket is a legal folder headed "Last Will and Testament"

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: He looks as if the truth has just hit him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goddamn will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: L.A.P.D.
dialogues.text: Valiant slowly returns the phone to the cradle,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you believe me? Now outside we HEAR TIRES SCREECHING to a stop.  Roger ru to the window and pulls back the drapes.  His eyes bug ou his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Toon Control! Valiant comes to the window and looks out, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toon Control wagon has stopped in front of the house. The Weasles pile out.  One of them takes what looks like butterfly net out of the back.  Several others grab violi cases.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND ROGER
dialogues.text: Valiant jerks Roger back behind the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from that window. Roger, elated, jumps into Valiant's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna help me?  How can I ever thank you? He plants a big wet Toon kiss on Valiant's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For starters... don't ever kiss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Weasles are filing up the walk to the front door.  Th leader pounds on the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant puts Roger down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to 'em.  Find a place to hide. Roger zips to the closet door and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in there.  That's the first place they'll look. Valiant goes to the closet and opens the door.  REVEAL Ro is now dressed in Eddie's trenchcoat and hat.  Playfully, Roger snaps one of the handcuffs onto Eddie's wrist.  He' got the Other attached to one of his wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie Valiant... you're under arrest! Just kidding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You idiot.  I lost the key for those cuffs. BOOM!  BOOM!  BOOM!  The KNOCKING is more impatient.  Val looks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Weasles open the violin cases and take out real tommy and shoulder them in teams of two.  Suddenly they unleash torrent of MACHINE GUN FIRE, making the outline of a weas in the door with BULLETS.  The leader blows on the cut-ou and it falls in.  The Weasles file through one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Weasles don't bother to look around.  They all just s BLASTING.  Bullets fly every which way.  The barrage dest Valiant's apartment in a matter of seconds.  When the shooting stops and the smoke clears, the Weasles look aro The head Weasle spots blood all over the kitchen floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got him. But when he looks behind the counter, it's only a shatter ketchup bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Roger, handcuffed together, are beating it down alley.  Roger, being a rabbit, is beating it a lot faster He's kicking up dust, his legs are blur.  Valiant stumble trying to keep up.  When they round the corner, Roger sla on the brakes, Toon style.  Valiant goes skidding past hi is jerked to a stop like a dog on a short leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  What do you think you're doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Eddie, I forgot you're not a Toon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever forget that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: come piling out the window.  They start sniffing the grou Suddenly one of them freezes on point, like a dog.  Anoth blows a HUNTER'S HORN and they're off on the trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: emerge from the alley.  They pause momentarily to reconnoiter.  Eddie decides to go left, Roger right.  Whe they get to the end of the cuffs, they snap back into a p Valiant gets back to his feet and hauls Roger up angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, goof... They start across the street.  But Roger goes on one side the Street sign, Eddie the other.  Roger coils around it a tether ball.  Valiant yanks Roger off the sign and they duck across the street just as a trolley car passes.

dialogues.speaker: THE WEASLES
dialogues.text: come bloodhounding around the corner.  They search the st for signs of the fugitive.  But when they get to the trol tracks, they stop, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scent's cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pssst. He points toward the trolley car pulling into the Termina Station.  They fall all over themselves scurrying over to trolley.  They surround it and jump aboard, tommy-gun at ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CONDUCTOR raises his hands like it was a hold-up.  A couple PASSENGERS scream as the Weasles search the car. no Roger or Eddie.  As quickly as they got on, they get o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it pulls away.  The Weasles look around perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny... I could swear I smelled rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: Eddie and Roger are balanced on the trolley wire above th Weasles' heads.  As the Weasles sniff around the barn, Ed and Roger ease along the wire, using the wall of the Term Bar to lean on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores is preparing corned beef and cabbage.  The RADIO PLAYING "MARES EAT OATS".  A NEWSCASTER breaks into the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: News flash... Hollywood.  Citywide Toonhunt for Roger Rabbit, suspect in Acme slaying.  Police describe him as short, cuddly...  and psychotic. Dolores turns just as Roger's grinning face appears in th window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother Mary... Now Eddie's face comes into view.  He motions for her to the window.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Roger and Eddie watch another trolley approach.  The cont arm sparks its way along the wire as it rolls along towar them.  Valiant watches as Dolores struggles to get the wi open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, hurry... At the last second, the window opens.  Eddie jumps for th sill, Roger dangling from the cuffs as the trolley passes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores helps pull Valiant through the window.  Then he d Roger inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Eddie, is this who I think it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores, meet Roger Rabbit. Roger bows at the waist, takes her hand and kisses it lik Charles Boyer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charmed, enchanted, pleasure's all mined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toon Fairy left him under my pillow. Now Roger spots a plate of freshly shucked corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I? Before she can answer, he grabs an ear, presses it to his lips and applies the typewriter method to it.  When he ge to the end of a row, we even HEAR the BING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a riot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?  Well, you're not handcuffed to him. (holds up cuffs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody in the back room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all yours. We FOLLOW Dolores as she leads Valiant and Roger across t hall.  She stops at a door, unlocks it, and leads them in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a tiny storage room/office with an institutional met desk, a cot, and assorted janitorial supplies stacked aro Dolores shuts and locks the door behind her.  Valiant goe a metal locker and digs through some tools, coming out wi hacksaw.  He sits on the cot and starts working on the cu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you decided to help him after all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I oughta have my head examined. (to Roger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you hold still? Roger quiets like a child for a moment as Valiant saws feverishly.  Then Roger slips his hand out of the cuff an holds his side while Eddie keeps sawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's better. Valiant saws a couple more strokes before the realization what Roger's done hits him.  His face darkens.  Roger see the look and sheepishly tries to recover by sticking his back in the cuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean to tell me you coulda taken your hand outta that cuff at any time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no, not any time.  Only when it was funny. Valiant looks at Roger like he's about to brain him.  Rog pulls his hand free again, and cowers out of range.  Vali just rubs his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you always this funny, or only on days when you're wanted for murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My philosophy is if you don't have a sense of humor, you're better off dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... well you just might get your wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get him out of it, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I can find whoever wanted to kill Acme bad enough to get this. Valiant throws the pattycake picture down on the table. Dolores and Roger both examine it closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acme's will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's what this little drama is all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I think Maroon plays the part of the sound mind, your wife the sound body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I resent that innuendo!  My wife is completely innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife may be a lot of things, pal, but innocent isn't one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the scam, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Baby Herman was right.  Somebody wants Acme's property.  Cack the old man, pin it on Roger, and destroy the will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The habeus corpus is thickening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Except they screwed up.  I don't think they got the will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Acme had the will in his pocket that night at the club.  It was gone in the morning when the cops found the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they just took it out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why'd they bother to crack the safe?  You can drop a Mosler 90 from Mount Baldy and it won't open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Smarty-Pants Detective, your logic is specious.  What prevented Mr. Acme from putting the will back in the safe before they killed him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he's not forty feet tall.  The safe was up on the ceiling, remember? Dolores whistles over his deductions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, you still got it.  Hey, tomorrow maybe I'll go down to probate court and see who's sniffin' around Acme's estate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, do that.  I'm gonna go rattle Maroon's cage. Valiant finishes sawing the cuffs.  He stands and throws cuffs aside.  Valiant and Dolores go to the door.  Roger follows them eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I do?  Who should I see? Where should I go? Valiant turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin', no one, nowhere, He slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: MAROON
dialogues.text: He's in a booth in the middle of a business lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe money grows on trees in Toontown, but not at the Maroon Studio. WIDEN THE SHOT to REVEAL that Maroon's sharing a booth wi BUGS BUNNY and his AGENT.  Bugs is chewing on a carrot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Doc, fiduciary considerations aside, Roger Rabbit may have been willing to play second banana to an ankle-biter, but I ain't.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: A MAITRE D' is leading Valiant and Augie, the deaf-mute t table by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll be fine, huh, Augie? Augie nods his head.  They sit and pick up the menus.  Au takes one peek and looks at Valiant, alarmed.  He scribbl note.  Valiant reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about the prices, pal.  If you want the shrimp cocktail, you have a shrimp cocktail. (puts menu down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Augie, I've got a little table-hopping to do. Valiant gets up from the table and starts across the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should know, R.K., we're in negotiations for Bugs to star in his own series at Warner Brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to scare up a bidding war between me and Jack Warner, eh?  Well, it won't work.  I'll call William Morris and I'll have 'em put out a rabbit call the likes of which this town's never seen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your dime, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And stop callin' me Doc!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, sure, Doc. Now Valiant arrives, pulls up a chair from next table and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Maroon.  Remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant?  What're you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I Just thought I'd drop by and show you a photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already seen your photographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I enlarged this one.  Thought you might be interested. Valiant takes an enlargement of the pattycake shot and pu it on the table in front of Maroon.  We can clearly see t will sticking out of Acme's pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway... enjoy your lunch. Valiant stands and departs.  But his visit has done it's trick.  Maroon looks l'ike he's seen a ghost.  We FOLLOW Valiant across the room to his table where Augie is blissfully attacking a shrimp cocktail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that, Augie, pretty good? Augie nods enthusiastically.  Valiant keeps an eye on Maroon's booth.  Now he nudges Augie as Maroon excuses himself and goes into the phone booth just outside the do Augie puts his shrimp fork down and picks up his pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Maroon talk on the phone MOS.  As his lips move, Valiant supplies his words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.  Valiant says there's a will. I don't know what he's trying to pull...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Valiant is reading of Augie's pad as Augie reads Maroon's lips, and scribbles down what he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's gonna have to take care of him. Augie looks up from his scribbling to exchange an eyebrow raising glance with Valiant.  Then he turns back to Maroo again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man had it at the club that night.  That's right.  Yeah, I'm sure. I'll be there. Augie stops writing as Maroon hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to Augie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? Augie shrugs his shoulders.  Disappointed, Valiant lights cigarette.  Now Augie elbows him and gestures across at Maroon, who's making another call.  Augie starts writing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iris... cancel my appointments this afternoon.  I'll be at Forest Lawn. Maroon hangs up the phone and comes out of the phone boot He hustles out of the room.  Valiant stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did great, Augie.  Have another shrimp cocktail. Valiant drops a twenty on the table and pats Augie on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CARHOP wheels a yellow Packard up in front.  Maroon cli in and ROARS off.  Valiant ENTERS THE FRAME.  He looks af Maroon, then calmly starts walking down the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Red Car pulls up.  Valiant climbs off.  He calmly cross the street and ducks behind the cemetery entranceway as Maroon's Packard ROARS through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love that Red Car. As Valiant starts to walk up the hill...

dialogues.speaker: THE ACME FUNERAL SITE
dialogues.text: A hearse, and a line of black limos are parked in the lan Nearby, Marvin Acme's funeral is in progress.  Clustered around a gravesite are the mourners... TOONS of every str There's MICKEY MOUSE comforting MINNIE.  TOM AND JERRY. HECKLE AND JECKLE.  CHIP 'N DALE.  Everyone from the famo to the not so famous is in attendance.  The eulogy is bei delivered in a familiar blustery Southern VOICE.  It's FOGHORN LEGHORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today we commit the body of brother Acme to the cold, I say cold, cold ground.  We shed no tears for we know that Marvin is going to a better place. That high, high, I say that high-larious place up in the sky. Foghorn Leghorn dramatically points skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-men!

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: is leaning up against a palm tree on the hill.  We have b watching the proceedings from his POV.  Now he sees Maroo car pull up.  He moves around to the other side of the tr as Maroon passes and starts wending his way through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE GRAVESITE
