dialogues.text: Foghorn Leghorn nods to the funeral DIRECTOR, a pasty-fac human in a black mourning coat.  The Director starts to t the crank lowering the coffin into the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a sign, brother Herman, that you've arrived... Much to the funeral Director's amazement, the crank start PLINKING Out the tune to "POP GOES THE WEASLE".  Now the mourners pick up on it and join in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Round and round the mullberry bush, The monkey chased the weasle... The crank and SONG start going FASTER AND FASTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monkey raid it all was in fun.  POP! Goes the weasle. Suddenly half of the lid to Acme's coffin flies open and harlequin CLOWN BOI-YOI-YOINGS out.  The funeral Director faints dead away as the Toon SOBS turn to LAUGHTER.  The Toons turn and head away from the grave comforted by a funeral befitting a gag king.  They climb into their cars SCREECH off like the start of the Indy 500.  One mourner left at the gravesite.  Sitting in a chair dabbing at her eyes with a handkerchief is Jessica Rabbit.  Maroon walks behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... trying to pull a fast one on me, huh? Jessica turns, startled.  She stands and faces Maroon.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: smiles and leans in.  This is the moment he's been waitin for.  Now just as the conversation begins, it is drowned by the NOISE from a LAWN MOWER.  Valiant turns to see a GARDENER riding around on a small tractor cutting the gra Valiant tries to flag him down as he watches Maroon and Jessica having an arguement.  There's accusatory finger pointing.  In pantomime, Maroon gestures into his pocket if describing the position of Acme's will. Jessica tries to leave.  He grabs her arm.  They're screa at each other but we don't hear a word.  Valiant waves frantically for the Gardener to cut the machine.  But the Gardener misconstrues it as a friendly greeting and waves back.  Valiant turns in time to see Jessica kick Maroon i the groin and stomp off to a red Auburn Speedster.  She j in and speeds away as Maroon staggers back to his car.  T Gardener stops the tractor next to Valiant.  He SHUTS OFF ENGINE.  The cemetery is completely still again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin' you want, mister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Steinway piano truck is parked next to the stage door. husky PIANO MOVERS are rolling a baby grand up the ramp t the stage door.  They knock on the door.  The Gorilla ope it and they muscle the piano inside.  After a moment, the reemerge.  We FOLLOW them back to the truck where a secon baby grand stands ready to be moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about you, but it makes me sick to think of these beautiful pianos gettin' chopped into match sticks every night by those screwy ducks. Struggling, they push this second piano into the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They roll the piano over to the wall and park it next to first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they call it entertainment. As they go out the stage door, MOVE IN on the baby grand.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PIANO
dialogues.text: is lying prone -- using the Steinway as his own Trojan Ho He lifts the piano lid to climb out, but then HEARS FOOTS approaching.  He lowers the lid again.  Now someone start testing the keys.  We see the hammers strike the strings, RUNNING UP THE SCALES until they reach the one under Valiant's nose.  The hammer whacks Valiant's nose on the backswing and strikes the string making a terrible SOUR N

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated QUACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phooey!  Out of tune again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to worry, Donald.  We can fix that with my sledgehammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind, Daffy.  I've got an axe in my dressing room. Valiant's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: PIANO
dialogues.text: as the VOICES of Daffy and Donald recede, Valiant raises lid and quickly climbs out.  He eases over to Jessica's dressing room.  As he starts to open the door, he HEARS SCUFFLING from inside.  Valiant puts his ear to the door. More SCUFFLING.  Valiant straightens, then suddenly whips door open and flicks on the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's there.  Perplexed, Valiant closes the door behin him and checks behind the dressing screen.  In the closet No one.  He shrugs and starts to search the room.  He goe Jessica's dressing table and rifles the drawers.  In her purse he discovers a Toon revolver.  He examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl's gotta protect herself. Valiant puts the gun back in the purse and closes the dra As he stands, he pauses to consider a Hurrel-like black-and-white photo of Roger Rabbit in a silver deco fr He's dramatically posed with a cigarette like he was Tyro Power. Valiant shakes his head and turns from the table.  Someth catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR
dialogues.text: Behind the dressing table, the corner of a piece of blue paper peeks out.  Valiant stoops down and fishes it out. It's a cover for a legal document -- "Last Will and Testa -- Marvin Acme".

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: stands, pleased.  He opens the blue folder.  But it's emp Valiant puts it in his inside pocket and turns to go when suddenly an unseen hand flicks the lights off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch... We can't see anything in the darkness.  But we hear the S of A FISTFIGHT.  There's the CRASHING of lamps and furnit breaking.  Now the door opens for a second as the assaila escapes.  Light floods in the room, illuminating Valiant the floor with a curtain wrapped around his head.  As he struggles free the door closes.  The room is dark again. Valiant scrambles to the door.  When he whips it open, RE the Gorilla framed in the doorway.  Valiant is frozen.  T Gorilla flicks on the light.  He smiles wickedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here I tought we had mice. Valiant tries to make a break for it.  WHAM!  The Gorilla lays him out cold with a right cross.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR
dialogues.text: As his vision comes INTO FOCUS, Valiant sees the Gorilla, Jessica Rabbit, the Weasles and Judge Doom are standing o him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I caught him rummagin' around in here.  Then I called you, Judge, on a counta you be da one we pay juice to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clears throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the right thing, Bongo.

dialogues.speaker: THE WEASLES
dialogues.text: pull a groggy Valiant upright and plop him in a chair in front of Doom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being caught breaking and entering is not very good advertising for a detective.  What were you looking for, Mr. Valiant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask her... Valiant nods toward Jessica, who stands coolly smoking a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week some heavy breather wanted one of my nylons as a souvenir.  Maybe that's what he was after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, doll, if I wanted underwear, I woulda broken into Frederick's of Hollywood.  I was lookin' for Marvin Acme's will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin Acme had no will.  I should know, the probate is in my court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a will, all right.  She took it off Acme the night she and R.K. Maroon knocked him off.  Then she set up her loving husband to take the fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, Mr. Valiant, are either drunk or punch drunk.  Probably both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are bold accusations, Mr. Valiant.  I hope you have some proof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the cover the will came in behind the dressing table. Valiant reaches into his pocket.  But the blue envelope i gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must've taken it off me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other people who were in here lookin' for the will.  I woulda caught 'em if Cheetah here hadn't interrupted me. The Gorilla makes a move for Valiant.  Doom stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Bongo.  We'll handle Mr. Valiant our own way... downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downtown?  Fine.  Get a hold of Santino, I'd be more than glad to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, not that downtown.  Toontown. The mention of Toontown has a visible impact on Valiant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not takin' me to downtown Toontown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed we are.  We'll continue the interrogation there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very agitated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't tellin' you nothin'!  Get me Santino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a very stubborn man, Mr. Valiant.  Very pig-headed.  Boys, show Mr. Valiant how we handle pig-headed men at the Toontown station... As the Weasles drag Valiant out of the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... you bastards!  Leggo of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Toon Control Wagon streaks along with the cat SIREN WAILING.  It flashes by then slams on the brakes at the entrance to an eerie tunnel.  A sign next to the tunnel s "Toontown".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Weasles look over at the bound and gagged Valiant.  O of them turns Valiant's head to look at the Toontown sign

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you shakin' for?  Didn't you have a good time last time you were here? With a wicked WHEEZE, the driver floors it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wagon disappears into the murky darkness.  PAN UP to night sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN to the tunnel.  We can't see into the darkness b we HEAR HOOTING and HOLLERING from within.  GUNS going of FIRECRACKERS EXPLODING, WHIPS CRACKING, all accompanied b the WHEEZING LAUGHTER of the Weasles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soo-eey!  Soo-eey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go, boys.  I think he's got the message. After a beat, Valiant comes staggering out of the tunnel. He's got a burlap sack over his head tied around his wais Behind him, the Weasles emerge holding paint cans and brushes.  They watch as he trips and falls by the side of road.  The Weasles GIGGLE victoriously and head back insi Valiant lies there for a moment, catching his breath.  Th he struggles to free his hands.  Finally he rips the sack his head and sits up.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: We see he's got a huge Toon pig with a goofy grin painted over his head.  Valiant pulls and tugs on it, but this is costume that won't come off.  Valiant curses, gets to his feet and stumbles down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant gets in the back of the line of PASSENGERS boardi the Red Car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: steps aboard.  The Trolleyman, who we recognize as Earl f the Terminal bar, does a double-take when he sees the ridiculously silly looking man/Toon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's one for the books... a Toon wearin' human clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl... it's me, Valiant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie?  Jesus, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toon cops worked me over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I'll say.  They gave you a real Toon-a-Roo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apprehensively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I, Earl? Earl breaks the news to Valiant soberly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a pig... a happy-go-lucky pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much.  It's hard to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Eddie, do me a favor.  Could you sit in the back so you won't cause as much of a commotion. Valiant tries to pull the brim of his hat down.  But it's comically small on the huge head.  He makes his way down aisle past a veritable gauntlet of RAZZING, poking, tripp PASSENGERS.  Finally he finds an empty seat in the back a the Red Car starts up.

dialogues.speaker: A LITTLE KID
dialogues.text: wearing a baseball cap is sitting a few seats away with h MOTHER.  The Kid looks back at Eddie and laughs.  He lean over and whispers something to his Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, darling.  Take your bat. The Kid takes his baseball bat and approaches Valiant innocently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Pig.  If I hit you on the head, will you make me a cuckoo bird? The Kid starts to take a swing with the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid, if you hit me on the head, I'm gonna throw you out this window. The Kid's eyes widen in terror.  This is not a typical To response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the SOUND of the SHOWER.  Valiant's hand reaches past the shower curtain and grabs for a bottle.  But it's shampoo.  It's turpentine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: TUB DRAIN
dialogues.text: The water swirling down the drain is tinged with paint of different colors.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: He scrubs manically until the last of the pig head is gon He rinses off and he feels around his face.  The absence the Toon mask seems to bring him some relief.  He shuts o the shower and slides the shower curtain back.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
dialogues.text: is leaning up against the doorjamb, dressed as usual, in black cocktail dress with elbow length gloves and pearls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Valiant.  I rang the doorbell, but I guess you couldn't hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because I don't have a doorbell. Jessica, caught in her lie, flutters her eyelids nervousl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... well, I... I just had to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you've seen me.  Now give me a towel. As she hands him a towel, she stares down at his anatomy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that thing? Valiant looks down at what she's referring to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, lady, haven't you ever seen a mole before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toons aren't given imperfections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?  I guess we're not counting lying, stealing and murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got the wrong idea about me. I'a a pawn in this just like poor Roger.  Can you help me find him?  I'll pay you anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll bet you would.  You gotta have the rabbit to make the scam work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no... I love my husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure.  I can just feature you standin' outside your little hutch, holdin' a carrot cake waitin' for hubby to come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please don't make fun of me, Mr, Valiant.  You don't know how hard it is being a woman looking the way I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you don't know how hard it is bein' a man looking at a woman looking the way you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not bad, I'm just drawn that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not complainin'.  But give me credit.  I'm the guy who took the pictures of you and Acme playin' pattycake, remember? Jessica takes a cigarette out of her purse.  She lights i and blows a cloud of Toon smoke.  It forms a recreation o what she describes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maroon came to me.  He told me he'd fire Roger if I didn't do it.  I went along with him for Roger's sake.  It was only pattycake, after all. Valiant waves at the smoke scene, dispelling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So altruistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth.  Why won't you believe it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I don't take Acme Dumb Pills.  I don't know what you're up to, lady, but I'm gonna nail you for the Acme murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm as bad as you think, what's stopping me from just killing you right now? Valiant reaches behind him and picks up a small cup on th sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cup of turpentine right here.  Go for that gun in your purse and I'm gonna let you have it. Jessica breaks down and starts sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mr, Valiant, please... you're my only hope. She comes to Eddie and hugs him, burying her head in his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm weak... you're strong.  Can't you find a place somewhere in your heart to help me? Valiant looks down at the luscious creature in his arms, considering the request.  The moment is interrupted by th CLEARING of a VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dabblin' in watercolors, Eddie? Valiant, still in just a towel, sheepishly turns to face Dolores, who's standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores... Dolores regards Jessica with undisguised contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme guess... your cousin from Des Moines? Jessica straightens her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Eddie... don't hate me. Jessica blows Eddie a TOON KISS which flies across the ro landing on Eddie's cheek.  She saunters past the smolderi Dolores and out the door.  Dolores walks to Eddie and pee the kiss off his cheek.  She crumples it up and throws it down in the wastebasket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the rabbit's wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rabbit's wife?  Wanna tell me what she was doin' with her arms around you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably lookin' for a good place to stick a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just stopped by to tell you that I checked out the Acme probate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maroon, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.  It's that Cloverleaf outfit again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell would they want with a gag factory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got me.  But unless the will shows up by Friday midnight, it's theirs. As Valiant considers this new development, he cocks an ea In the distance, we HEAR FAINT SINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that comin' from the bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like singin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no... As Valiant grabs his pants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger's out all right.  In fact, he's using the bar as a stage for a song and dance number.  The tune is extremely familiar.  In fact, it's the one that opens every Warner Brothers cartoon...  The Looney Tune Anthem.  But we've n heard words to go with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The merry-go-round broke down But you don't see me frown...' Roger grabs Augie's pad and pencil, scribbles some drawin lightning fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Things turned out fine And now she's mine...' Roger flips through the pad which in crude animation, sho the story of Roger and Jessica getting back together, culminating in them kissing in a heart.  Augie's delighte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... Cause the merry-go-round Went round... Hoo-hoo, Hoo-hoo...' Roger does backflips and acts like an escapee from the ac ward.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR OPENS
dialogues.text: Eddie and Dolores enter.  Valiant stops in his tracks at sight of Roger's performance... and the smiles on the fac of the sourpusses.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: doesn't see Eddie.  He moves into the next verse.  He twi around on the post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'My name is Roger Rabbit I've got a crazy habit I like to sing and dance and yuk...' Roger goes to Angelo, lifts off his cap, and whacks his toupee, making it spin like a top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... So brighten up and smile You schmuck'. All the regulars in the bar have a good laugh at that one Now as Roger twirls around on the post, he smashes into a tray held by Eddie.  Valiant carries him toward the back room, but the irrepressable entertainer gets on his knees Jolson style and blows kisses to his audience.  The regul are HOWLING as Roger is carried out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant flings Roger into the room and slams the door beh him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't I get an encore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you crazy Toon... I've been out there riskin' my neck for you.   I come back here and you're singin' and dancin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's my calling, my purpose, my raison d'etre.  Toons are supposed to make people laugh... and believe me, those people needed a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when they're done laughin' , they're gonna call the cops.  That guy Angelo would rat on you for a nickel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angelo?  He's a pal, a chum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An arsonist and a kidnapper.  He just got outta prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I still don't think he'd turn me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because you got 'em to laugh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A laugh can be a powerful thing, Eddie. Sometimes it's the only weapon we have in life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I prefer the Smith and Wesson variety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've met some cynical and miserable humans in my time.  But you, Edward Valiant, are positively funereal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, right now it's gonna be your funereal. Valiant takes his fist back to belt Roger.  Roger stands stoicly, jaw thrust forward, eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and throw that punch. (opens one eye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you'd be more successful with a punch line. Valiant drops his fist and rubs his temples with frustrat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're driving me crazy, you know that? Let's go... you ruined this as a hiding place. Valiant grabs Roger by the scruff of the neck and opens t door.  But he ducks back in quickly.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT'S POW
dialogues.text: has entered the bar.  He stands FRAMED in the doorway, Voltaire perched on his shoulder.  The red light of the n sign flashes on his glasses making him look like he's got burning coals for eyes.  With the Weasles at the door bac him up, the satanic Doom walks to the bar, his FOOTSTEPS CREAKING along the wooden floor.  He surveys the scene, l over the bar for a glass.  Doom holds the glass up to the light and looks at it disgustedly.  He picks up a bottle scotch and carries it down to where the one-armed Soldier sitting.  Doom stares at him, then pulls the empty sleeve of the amputee's pocket.  He uses it to wipe the inside o the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for a rabbit.  He was last seen in this neighborhood. The barflies avoid Doom's stare and shoot covered glances one another.  But nobody says a word.  Doom pours a drink into his newly cleaned glass... then gently pours it down Voltaire's gullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't miss him.  Buck teeth. Orange pants.  About yea big. Doom squashes the Midget's head down to approximate the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no rabbit here, so don't harass my customers. Doom turns to Dolores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't come here to harass.  I came here to reward. Doom walks around Dolores toward the back.  But Doom stop next to the blackboard.  On it is written:  "Today's Spec - French Dip - $ .50".  Doom erases the "French" and the decimal point in front of the "50".  Then he picks up the chalk and starts to write.  The CHALK SQUEAKS excruciatin on the blackboard.  Everyone winces but watches anyway, a Doom writes "Rabbit" where the "French" was, and adds the zeroes to the "50".  It now reads:  "Rabbit Dip - $5000".

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: are fixed on the figure on the blackboard.  Angelo licks lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I seen a rabbit... Angelo looks defensively at all his cronies and back to D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right here in the bar. But instead of pointing to the back of the bar, he talks the empty barstool beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say 'ello, Harvey. The tension is broken.  Everybody at the bar starts HOWLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger turns to Eddie victoriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pal.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BAR
dialogues.text: Doom stares down the regulars until the laughter stops. Meanwhile, a Weasle has started sniffing around the bar w Roger was dancing.  As Doom turns to leave, the Weasle whispers in his ear as he points to the back.  Doom smile and pats the Weasle on the head.  He turns to Angelo and others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we'll see who laughs best... The Weasle bloodhounds through the bar with Doom striding after him.  We FOLLOW them to the door to the back room. Doom rips the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark.  Doom flicks on the light.  REVEAL Valiant on cot, his pint bottle cradled in his arm.  He blinks as if awakened from a drunken slumber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant?  Why is it that whenever my men smell a rabbit, you're there? Valiant plumps the pillow behind his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be my cologne... Eau Dc Carrot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in here all right, boss. Suddenly the Weasle grabs the pillow from under Valiant's head and carves it to shreds with a switchblade.  Feather fly.  But no rabbit fur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Youse want we should take the place apart? The rest of the Weasles are arrayed behind Doom with Toon crowbars, picks, and a jackhammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sergeant.  That won't be necessary. Doom walks over to the locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a trick that no Toon can resist. Doom raps on the locker with his knuckles.  Da-da-da-da-d It's a familiar pattern that demands a Da-da response.  D moves to the desk and tries it again.  Da-da-da-da-da...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE A MAXWELL HOUSE COFFEE CAN
dialogues.text: Roger is hiding while sweating out the urge to finish the familiar coda.  We HEAR the RAPPING again, closer. Da-da-da-da-da...  Roger's biting his nails.

dialogues.speaker: DOOM
dialogues.text: moves to the milk crate the coffee can is on.  Valiant ge up off the cot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Doom, I don't know who's Toonier, you or the rabbit. Doom just smiles and knocks the pattern out on the crate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shave... and... a haircut... Roger bursts out of the can with the lid on his head.  He responds con brio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two... bits! (looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... oh... PSSSHEW!  Roger flies out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He streaks across the bar and out the front door.   After beat, two Weasles step into the bar holding the butterfly they had stretched across the door.  They WHEEZE with gle the struggling Roger trapped inside.  A third Weasle carr the Judge's briefcase. Doom strides confidently into the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oyez... oyez... oyez... court is now in session. Valiant and Dolores are led out by a couple Weasles holdi guns on them.  As Doom snaps the briefcase open on the ba the twelve Kangaroos pop up in their jury box.  Doom raps the bar with his gavel-headed cane.  The regulars watch t bizarre scene in stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger Rabbit is charged with the cold blooded murder of a human... Marvin Acme.  The jury will direct their attention to exhibits A, B, and C. The Weasles display photographs of Jessica and Acme playi pattycake, a blow-up of his fingerprints spelling RogerRabbitRogerRabbit in the whorls on the photographs, a picture of Acme lying under the safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motive, evidence, modus operandi.  How do you find the defendant? Once again the Kangaroo court wastes no time delivering t verdict.  The Baby Kangaroos pop up with their Y-O-U A-R- G-U-I-L-T-Y signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty as charged.  Case closed! Doom slams the briefcase shut.  Now two Weasles wheel the stainless steel tub filled with dip into the bar.  Anothe hands Doom his black rubber gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For this heinous crime, I sentence you to the dip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. not the dip!  Eddie, tell him I didn't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's gonna matter. Sorry, pal, I tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and for that you're charged with aiding and abetting.  But we'll let Santino handle that. Doom pulls on the rubber gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, doesn't the rabbit even get a last request?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blindfold, cigarette, noseplugs? Just kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you want a drink. (to Doom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about it, Judge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why not?  I'm feeling magnanimous tonight.  The successful conclusion of this case draws the curtain on my career as a jurist. I'm retiring to take a new role in the private sector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Well, don't expect the Toons to give you a gold watch. Valiant pours a glass of whiskey filling it all the way t the rim.  He holds it out to Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, kid... say hi to Casper for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Eddie, you know what happens when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink it, jerk.  All of it. He grabs Roger's hand and forces the drink into it.  Roge shrugs his shoulders and shoots the drink down.  We've se the reaction before.  Suddenly Roger's head turns into a STEAM WHISTLE emitting such a PIERCING BLAST that is send everyone into ear-grabbing agony.  Glasses, bottles, mirr even Doom's glasses SHATTER.  Valiant uses the distractio punch the Weasles holding Roger.  He grabs the rabbit by scruff of the neck. He gets as assist from Augie, who couldn't hear the noise.  Unfazed, Augie whacks a Weasle the head with a barstool.  The Midget crawls behind Doom, who's been momentarily blinded.  The one-armed Soldier pu him over.  Angelo is turning one Weasle's head around and around like a cruller.  Finally, Doom gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After them you fools... As the Weasles regroup, Valiant tips the stainless steel over sending the dip spilling toward them.  The Weasles recoil from the liquid.  Even Doom takes a step backward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Roger race down the stairs and toward the Toon Control Wagon which is parked in front of Doom's Lincoln,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Eddie, that was quick thinkin'. Nothin' like usin' the old noggin, the noodle, the grey matter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm so smart, how come I'm runnin' from the law with a Toon? Valiant opens the door of the Toon Control wagon, and fli Roger inside roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie goes to start the vehicle but the key is gone.   No from behind them comes a DEEP RUMBLING VOICE somewhere between Lord Buckley and Barry White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, gentlemen... Eddie and Roger turn.  A snazzy TOON ROADSTER whose grill functions as it's mouth is talking from behind the liquid bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you effect my extrication, I could offer you some carburetion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant sighs with resignation and slides out of the cab, Roger in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Roger come racing around the side of the wagon. Valiant searches the back of the truck for the on/off swi He finds it and turns off the flow of acetone.  The Roads zips out of the truck and lands on the pavement, already flexing and limbering.   Behind him, a comical number of TOON DETAINEES hop out like midgets out of a Volkswagon. They all head for the hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... what're we waitin' for, the William Tell Overture?

dialogues.speaker: TERMINAL BAR
dialogues.text: come piling out.  They stack up like an Indian totem pole searching every direction.  One of them spots Eddie and Roger.  The Weasles stumble all over themselves in a mad scramble down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND ROGER
dialogues.text: hop into the sleek two-seater.   Valiant looks at the myr of goofy cartoon gauges and switches on the Roadster's dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do nothin'... With a ferocious RUBBER BURNING SQUEAL, the Roadster ROAR off in "no frames".  The exit is so fast that Eddie and R are left behind, hanging mid-air.  But before they hit th ground, the Roadster zips back INTO FRAME.  Eddie and Rog fall back into their seats.  The Roadster bends around so grill is facing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... except hang onto your hat. The Roadster ROARS off again in a cloud of Toon dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: coming the other way.  It's followed by another squad car both with SIRENS BLARING.  When the red blur streaks by, Santino turns to his PARTNER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speeding rabbit, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I was afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santino's car does a 180 degree spin, and goes after the Roadster.  The second squad car follows.  The Weasles pil into the Toon Control wagon and join the chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rockets down the street, then takes a turn so wide that i drives up the front of the corner building, then back dow the sidewalk, just avoiding a newsstand.  The squad car following is not so dexterous.   It CRASHES into the stan sending newspapers flying.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROADSTER
dialogues.text: looks back over it's shoulder, admiring his handiwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read all about it, Benny's back in town! Up ahead, an egg delivery truck is double-parked in their lane.  Benny snaps around just as they're about to crash the back of the truck.  There's nowhere to go.   But Benn cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going up... Suddenly, just before impact, the Toon suspension on the accordions up, giving it a clearance of about fifteen fee just enough to get over the truck.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOON CONTROL WAGON
dialogues.text: doesn't come with this unique feature.  It tries to avoid truck but SMASHES into the back, splattering hundreds of and sending the Weasles flying.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND ROGER
dialogues.text: look down from their suspended position at the chaos behi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next floor, sundries, knick knacks, escaped convicts.  Watch your step. The Roadster accordions back down to it's original height speeds past TWO MOTORCYCLE COPS.  The motorcycles ROAR af them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Benny, what were you in for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reckless driving.  Do you believe that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to imagine. Benny zig-zags through traffic, scooting between cars, bu the Motorcycle Cops manage to stay on his tail.  Up ahead traffic is stopped in his lane.  With nowhere to go, Benn passes a trolley car moving down the center of the street Suddenly, he swerves in front of the trolley to elude the Cops... only to see another Red Car coming the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your breath, babies... Benny sucks in his girth and gets on his tip-toes as the trollies pass on either side of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the trollies clear, Benny staggers out from between still on tip-toes.  Benny plops down, squashes, then pops to his old self again.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THEM
dialogues.text: The crippled Toon Control wagon is struggling to keep up. Voltaire circles above the truck and picks two Weasles up the roof.  They're each carrying several sticks of dynami

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE AIR
dialogues.text: We see Voltaire flying after the Roadster, which is speed along the palm-lined Elysian Park Drive.  The Weasles lig the dynamite sticks and with WHEEZING delight, bombard th car below.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: swerves right and left dodging the EXPLOSIONS.  Now a sti of dynamite falls into the back seat, fuse burning.  Benn looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to sound like Chicken Little, but is the sky falling or what? Eddie and Roger turn to see the dynamite, fuse burning lo Valiant makes a desperate grab for it.  But it rolls unde the front seat.  Roger jumps in Eddie's lap.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: satisfied that they've hit their target, swoop back to th Toon Control wagon.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ROADSTER
dialogues.text: Valiant tries to untangle himself from Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab it, you idiot! Finally, at the last second, Roger reaches down and picks dynamite up like a hot potato.  He flips it out of the Roadster.

dialogues.speaker: THE DYNAMITE
dialogues.text: spins through the air, finally landing on the roof just a Voltaire and the Weasles arrive.  BOOM!  The Toon Control wagon is demolished.  When the smoke clears we see the Weasles and Voltaire scattered roadside, faces blackened, feathers smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny is leading a merry chase up and down the hills.  Be the two Motorcycles, there are half a dozen squad cars. as Benny comes over the last rise, we see the road deaden at Echo Park Lake.  The police have blocked off the perpendicular streets with squad cars.  Eddie and Roger s the deadend fast approaching.  Roger covers his eyes with ears.  Valiant braces himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brakes!  The brakes! Benny hits the brakes.  Smoke pours out as they burn up a the momentum is barely broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the brakes, who brought the water wings? The Roadster SMASHES through the wooden guard rail and sa out over the water.  KERPLOP!  It splashes down in the la

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE CARS
dialogues.text: SCREECH to a stop at the edge of the lake.  Santino jumps and regards the floating Roadster.  He turns to the other cops with a smirk.  When he turns back again, the smirk disappears from his face.

dialogues.speaker: LAKE
dialogues.text: Benny is calmly swimming away using his fenders to do the crawl.  Now they pass a spooning COUPLE in a rowboat.  Th couple regard them open-mouthed.

dialogues.speaker: THE EDGE OF THE LAKE
dialogues.text: Benny nears the shoreline, touches bottom and wades out. When they hit dry land, Benny shakes off like a dog.  He HIS ENGINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's my imagination, but I always seem to run better after I've had a wash. (turns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now where can I drop you cats? As Benny ROARS off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny peeks around the corner, then tip-toes into view. d the alley until he stops in front of a back door.  Eddie Roger climb out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Benny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever need me, just stick out your thumb. WHOOSH!  Benny is gone.  Valiant goes to the door and unl it.  As he and Roger head up the back stairs...

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY
dialogues.text: A hand painted design on the rippled glass shows a knight a white charger.  On the shield in bold letters it says, "Veritas".  And lettered around it -- "Valiant and Valian Private Investigation".

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: sticks his key in the door and unlocks it.  Roger studies banner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant and Valiant?  Who's the other Valiant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother.  Get inside. He pushes Roger into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a typical detective office -- a couch, a sink, a win -- except for the partner's desk in the middle of the roo There's a chair on each side.  Valiant closes the door an locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's our plan, our scenario, our modus operandi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't do anything till it's dark. Valiant picks up some yellowed newspapers off the couch a dumps them on the floor.  They leave a clean spot on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you haven't been here in a while. (reads headline)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Japs Bomb Pearl Harbor'. Roger walks over to the wall.  He takes a framed picture the wall which shows two guys clowning with Mickey Mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, who's this guy laughin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, I didn't recognize you... I've never seen you laugh before.  That your brother makin' the rabbit ears?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, Twenty Questions? Valiant grabs the picture from Roger and re-hangs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get some sleep.  I suggest you do the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant stretches out on the couch.  Roger nudges him to over so he can lie down.  Grudgingly, Valiant slides over fraction giving Roger a tiny piece of the couch.  They li head to foot.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: The problems of the day are knitting his brow.  Finally h eyes close.  After a beat, we HEAR Roger SNORING.  It's L Valiant's eyes pop open.  He rolls over.  WIDEN THE SHOT see what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE ROGER'S HEAD
dialogues.text: has appeared.  Inside the bubble is a saw sawing back and forth through a log.  It is SYNCHRONIZED to the SOUND of Roger's SNORE.  Valiant kicks Roger, trying to stop the infernal SOUND. Roger sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? In the dream bubble, the saw cuts through the log.  One e of the log falls out of the bubble and BONKS Roger on the head, knocking him unconscious.  Valiant shakes his head closes his eyes again.  We PAN UP off his face and PAST t window where the sun is setting.  As the CAMERA MOVES ALO THE WALL, we see a gallery of framed newspaper clippings. "Valiant and Valiant Crack Popeye Kidnapping - Return Swe to Loving Arms of Parents".  And... "Brothers Find Brothe Heckle and Jeckle Rescued From Redwood Forest!"  And... "Goofy Cleared of Atomic Spying Charges".  The PAN CONTIN until we get to the window again.  Now it's dark outside. MOVE DOWN to Valiant's sleeping face.  He stirs. then ope one eye.  Now they both pop open at what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger has a magnifying glass an inch in front of his face that distorts his grinning face hideously.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: startled from his sleep, reflexively shoves Roger away fr him.  He flies into a swivel chair and goes spinning arou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You damn Toon!  No wonder they picked you for the patsy.  Always gotta play the fool.  You make me sick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, you shamuses are a tough audience, but what happened to you that was so dark, lurid, embittering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna know?  Well, since you're so goddamn curious, I'll tell ya.  One of you Toons killed my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Toon?  Noooo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a Toon.  It was the guy who killed Bambi's mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him?  Oh, he was vile, heinous, despicable... a smear on the drafting board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, everybody thought so.  But me and Teddy got a kick out of Toons.  All Toons.  We couldn't see the bad in 'em. And when this guy was accused of knockin' over the First National Bank of Toontown, we took his case.  But when we looked into it, we found out he did do it after all.  We went to his house to take him in.  But he was wise. He got the drop on us... literally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piano.  Guy got away, disappeared into Toontown.  Nobody ever saw him again. Now the PHONE on the desk RINGS.  Roger makes a move to i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from there. The PHONE RINGS TWO MORE TIMES and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not. Valiant goes to the phone anticipating a RING which comes after a moment.  Valiant picks up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores?

dialogues.speaker: DOLORES
dialogues.text: on the phone in the Terminal Bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hopin' you'd be there.  Maroon's called here about four times.  He says he's gotta talk to you tonight.  He says he can help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna call him, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What've I got to lose?  You okay, Dolores?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... they closed me down for a coupla weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll work out just fine.  When this thing is over, I'll take you to Catalina.  How does that sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Familiar.  Be careful, Eddie. Dolores hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: He CLICKS the switchhook and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maroon?  Whaddaya want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got the will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me at my studio at nine o'clock. If you've got the will maybe we can stop this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop what? CLICK.  Maroon has hung up.  Valiant hangs up the phone a goes to a wall safe.  He spins the combination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, Eddie, you're not gonna go, are ya?  Maroon'll be layin' for ya at nine o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'll be there at 8:45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you what, maybe I better come with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. Valiant reaches into the safe for a .38 revolver.  He che the cylinder. Then he takes out a wooden box about 8" X 1 He closes the safe, picks up a black doctor's bag and put the box and the revolver into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Eddie, I'm not as much of a chump, and a patsy, a yokel as you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is a shave and a haircut, Roger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two bits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rest my case. Valiant goes to the door, pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't make it back here by ten...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'd head for Cucamonga. Valiant closes the door, leaving Roger alone.  Roger pace back and forth manically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cucamonga?  I don't know anybody in Cucamonga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lot is dark and deserted.  Now headlights cut through darkness as Maroon's Packard pulls up in front of the Administration building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reaches over and opens the glove compartment.  He takes o small automatic.  But his hands are so slippery with perspiration, it falls to the floor.  Cursing, he takes o a handkerchief, wipes his hands and his face and picks up gun again.  As he gets out of the car, we see the clock s 8:55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maroon hustles up to his office door.  He looks nervously over his shoulder, then goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maroon switches on the lights.  He goes to his desk.  He takes out the gun and puts it in the left hand drawer.  T he takes it out and puts it in the right hand drawer.  Th back to the original drawer.  Finally satisfied, he goes the bar to calm his obviously shattered nerves.  As his shakey hand starts to pour from the decanter, another han comes INTO FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady, R.K., that stuff's eighteen years old. Maroon jumps back as Valiant steps from behind the curtai holding his black bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant!  You surprised me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the idea. Valiant takes over the pouring duties.  He turns and carr Maroon's drink to him.  Maroon goes and sits down in his chair.  He looks to the pistol hiding place.  Valiant casually sits on the desk, putting his legs over the draw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not too good at this, are you,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I'm not.  I'm a cartoon maker, not a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, everybody needs a hobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you gotta understand, Valiant, I had nothin' to do with Acme gettin' killed.  I just wanted to sell my studio.  But they wouldn't buy my property unless Acme would sell his. And he wouldn't.  So I was gonna blackmail Acme with pictures of him and the rabbit's wife. Maroon gets up from his chair, highly agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then it all went to hell.  I been around Toons all my life.  I can't sit around and see them all destroyed. Maroon eyes Valiant's black bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the will in there, don't ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tricked me, damn you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no time to take it easy!  You don't realize the diabolical mind we're dealing with!

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW
dialogues.text: A gun pokes through the open window past the curtain.  It Colt .45 Buntline -- an unmistakeable gun with an extra l barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't get that will by midnight tonight, Toontown's just gonna be land for the free...

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: sees a reflection of the gun on the glass on a movie post on the wall.  He turns.  But it's too late.  BANG!  BANG! BANG!  Maroon crumples, caught mid-sentence.  Valiant div behind the desk and draws his gun.  He looks over at Maro dead body on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the home of the brave? Valiant crawls to the window where the shots came from. looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The comely silhouette of Jessica Rabbit runs to her car, jumps in and ROARS out the the studio gates.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: grabs his black bag, climbs out of the office window and jumps off the fire escape to the lot below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant hops into Maroon's Packard.  He hits the starter button and takes off after Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the car pulls away, the trunk lid lifts.  Roger Rabbit peers out, disoriented.  Then closes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica's car speeds along.  Valiant is in close pursuit the Packard.  He's about to catch up on the straightaway Jessica's car disappears into a tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: slams on his brakes.  The Packard goes fishtailing, final spinning to a stop at the foot of the "Toontown" sign. Valiant gets out of the car.  He looks down the tunnel. sweating.  He loosens his necktie.  He paces back and for at the tunnel mouth.  He looks up at the Toontown sign an suddenly smashes it with his fist.  It spins around like weathervane. Valiant walks to the Packard with purpose.  He grabs the black bag and puts it on the hood.  He opens it and takes the wooden box.

dialogues.speaker: BOX
dialogues.text: as the clasp is popped and the box opened, REVEAL a stunn presentation model TOON .38 resting on crushed velvet.  I everything a real gun could be... and more.  Each feature exaggerated... the barrel, the cylinder, the ivory grips all Toon-sized.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: picks the gun up and hefts it respectfully.  Then he open ammo section in the wooden box. SIX TOON .38 DUM-DUM BULL are in velvet creases.  The Toon Bullets blink to life as awakening from a long sleep. DUM-DUM #l (rubbing eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie... is that really you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What year is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who won the war?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think, dummy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been the last five years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drunk. He opens the cylinder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feelin' frisky tonight, boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! The Bullets eagerly dive into their respective chambers. snaps the cylinder closed, reaches into his shoulder hols and takes out the pint bottle.  He unscrews the cap and p the rest of the booze onto the ground.  When it's drained flings the bottle in the air and FIRES the Toon .38.  KA- It makes a SOUND like a CANNON.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOON BULLET
dialogues.text: climbs like a rocket into the dark sky.  It SCREECHES up the bottle, puts on the brakes.  The Bullet puts on a jeweler's eyepiece, then it whips out a little hammer and chisel acd delivers one delicate tap.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: watches as a cut glass chandelier falls out of the sky an CRASHES at his feet.  Valiant holsters his weapon and cli into the Packard.  He puts it in gear and pulls into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: As Valiant heads toward the proverbial light at the end o the tunnel, suddenly the CAR RADIO COMES ON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... From the tippy tip top of Toontown's Tip Top Club, this is Mellow Melody Matinee.  Here's our favorite cricket, Jimmy, with 'Give A Little Whistle'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'When you get in trouble, and you don't know right from wrong...' Valiant turns the on/off switch, then punches all the but but to no avail.  The SONG PLAYS ON anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... Give a little whistle Give a little whistle...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate Toontown... As Jimmy croons on, Valiant emerges from the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT'S FOV
dialogues.text: Through the windshield we see we have arrived in Toontown where it's a beautiful sunny day.  Eddie is now driving d a phantasmagorical boulevard in a completely animated wor It's a Max Fleischer version of a city neighborhood.  The trees and buildings are swaying in time with the MUSIC. Eddie looks to his left and sees a huge Aphrodite-like ho ornament on the front of a TOON CAR.  Then as the car sta to pass him he sees hood... hood... hood... more hood the CHAUFFEUR, then more car, and finally the Wolf we remembe from the Ink & Paint Club.  He's in top hat and tails, a LAMB in the passenger seat.  He tips his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helloooo, cousin. Now he drives past a Toon building under construction.  L everything else in Toontown. the construction company spo the name "Acme".  The sign out frontsays:  WATCH OUR PROGRESS.  Eddie looks up, and before he can drive by, th building gets built floor by floor with accompanying SFX about two seconds. Up ahead, the street is clear for blocks.  Then suddenly pour out of all side streets at once, clogging the boulev like arteriosclerosis.  There is mad HONKING in this cart traffic jam.  Eddie shakes his head.  He pulls over, park and gets out. Valiant pulls out his Toon .38.  Suddenly, the street emp in the blink of an eye.  Shutters close, and the sidewalk rolls up like window shades.  It's so quiet you could hea pin drop.  In fact, a PIN DROPS from a second story windo landing with the CLANG! of a manhole cover.  All is quiet again.  Valiant starts across the street -- there is a CR behind him.  Valiant whirls around, levelling his pistol the sound.

dialogues.speaker: PACKARD
dialogues.text: peeks out of the trunk of Maroon's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot, Eddie.  It's me. Valiant lowers the gun as Roger emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doin' in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I followed you to the Maroon Studios. When I heard those shots, I thought I'd help you and investigate the inside of this trunk. Valiant reaches into the black bag in the car.  He comes with a pair of TOON HANDCUFFS.  He slaps one on Roger's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what're you doin'? Valiant drags Roger to the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making sure you don't help me anymore. He locks the cuff to it, and heads across the street.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: stops at a street sign.  The post is bristling with finge pointing in different directions; i.e., Poughkeepsie, Transylvania, Walla Walla, South Pole (the finger points of course), and finally a finger which says:  The Dame. Eddie follows the finger down the side street to a high r building. He catches a glimpse of Jessica darting into the elevator Valiant hustles inside after her. Valiant goes to the elevators, and watches the floor indicator spinning round and Round, finally stopping with BING at the 125th floor.  The elevator doors open and Val steps on.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Valiant punches 125.  Suddenly the elevator takes out wit such velocity that Valiant is thrown to the floor.  After moment, it stops so fast that he hits the ceiling.  Then bounces back to the floor as the doors open.  He picks himself up and steps off the elevator. He's in a foyer with four doors.  Valiant opens the first steps inside.  He disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant is on the outside of the building hanging onto a flagpole for dear life.  He looks down at the street whic looks miles below.  Valiant inches back along the flagpol the door and pulls himself to safety.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: tries the next door.  This time more carefully.  A SPEEDI TRAIN is coming right at him.  He slams the door.  He tri the next one.  A homely OLD TOON LADY is in a bathtub.  S lets out a BLOODCURDLING SCREAM.  Valiant closes that doo quickly, and turns to the last.  When he opens this one, HEAR FOREBODING MUSIC.  We see...

dialogues.speaker: A DARK ALLEY
dialogues.text: Warily, Valiant walks into the alley, gun drawn.  There's NOISE behind the garbage cans.  Valiant turns as a DEAD B with a knife in his back falls out of the shadows at Valiant's feet.  A SQUEAKY VOICE comes from behind Valian

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess they didn't clean up after the last moider. Valiant whips around to see a TOON RAT perched on a skull picking his teeth.  Valiant kicks the skull.  The rat scrambles for cover. As Valiant continues on, we see...

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA RABBIT
dialogues.text: Steps out of the shadows behind him and aim the gun at hi back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move, Valiant. Valiant turns slowly to see Jessica's got a bead on him w her revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I always figured I'd get it in Toontown. BLAM!  She fires.  But Valiant's still standing.  We HEAR CRASH behind Eddie as a figure falls into some boxes from fire escape above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I got him. Jessica runs past Valiant to the figure.  He follows, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND
dialogues.text: We can see two rabbit ears sticking out from behind a box

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shot Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not Roger.  It's one of Doom's men.  He killed R.K. Maroon. Jessica moves the box aside and tugs on the rabbit ears. rabbit head pops off.  Underneath is a Weasle.  In his ha is the Colt .45 Buntline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, I guess I had you pegged wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you're not the first.  We better get out of here. As they run down the alley...

dialogues.speaker: THE PACKARD
dialogues.text: is behind the wheel making ENGINE NOISES like a little ki He pushes all the buttons, windshield wipers, convertible top, etcetera, until he accidentally hits the starter but VROOM!  The Packard fires to life.  Roger's startled for moment, but quickly regains his composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm... What would be the harm if I took her for a spin? He throws it into gear.  The Packard bucks into the car i front of it.  Then Roger shifts again.  The same process repeated in reverse.  He SMASHES back and forth.  BANG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... the open road.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: come racing down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Doom who killed Acme, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know who I could trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're even.  By the way, I did find your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right here in the... Valiant rounds the corner and points toward the spot wher the car used to be.  But all that remains is a crumpled bumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... car. He shakes his head and looks around for signs of Roger.

dialogues.speaker: THE PACKARD
dialogues.text: is careening down Toon streets totally out of control. Panicked, Roger is spinning the wheel as if it were a motorboat.  He drives in one side of Mother Goose's Shoe out the other, diapers all over the windshield.  Unable t see, Roger steers right off the road.  The car hurtles through space.  As it starts to fall, we see it's Toon Monument Valley.  The Packard passes a promontory on whic WILE E. COYOTE is perched.  As Roger passes, he waves to Coyote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Roger Rabbit.  Love your work.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND JESSICA
dialogues.text: who are now facing a squad of TEN Toon Control Weasles. unleash a fusilade of bullets. Valiant knocks Jessica to the ground.  The bullets pass harmlessly overhead going into the window of the Acme Che Shop, riddling a round of cheese.  The CHEESEMAKER'S hand comes INTO FRAME changing the sign that says "Gouda" to "Swiss". Valiant rolls and FIRES his Toon .38 Special.  The Toon Bullet turns into a cannonball, which rolls down the stre busting up the Weasle squad like a bowling ball through t pins. As Eddie pulls Jessica to her feet, two more Weasles desc on them.  They fling Toon knives, which pin Eddie to a wo fence.  Valiant rips one hand free, and BLASTS two shots them. The Toon Bullets get to the Weasles, and open their nose cones.  Two frying pans emerge and BONK the Weasles on th head. Jessica starts to pull the knives out, releasing Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get onto Doom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin told me.  Doom was after his land.  Ne was afraid.  That's why he brought me his will. Valiant sees a Weasle skulking at them with a tommygun. BLAM!  Valiant fires at him.  The Weasle ducks back aroun the corner.  But Valiant's Dum-Dum SCREECHES to a stop an goes around the corner, too.  We HEAR an EXPLOSION.  The Weasle come staggering out and falls in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I opened up the blue envelope, all that was inside was a blank piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A joker to the end. Now Weasles are coming at them from every direction.  Val aims the Toon .38 at a Toon tank rolling their way.  But he pulls the trigger, the gun just CLICKS.  Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like our goose is cooked, our hash is slung, our fait is accompli...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme guess where you got that from. Tell me somethin', what'd you ever see in that guy anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made me laugh. Valiant shakes his head.  Now they are completely surroun by Weasles.  The situation looks bleak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do you prefer to die this way or that way? Valiant jerks his thumb indicating the direction behind h Suddenly, there's a rubber-burning SCREECH as Benny the Roadster arrives next to Valiant's hitchhiker-posed thumb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a lift? Valiant does a take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny. The Roadster looks back approvingly as Jessica climbs in Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Valiant, you've made a vast improvement in the company you keep. Benny blasts through a couple of Weasles.  They swing bac and forth like tavern doors, then topple. He takes a hard right into the next block which is the To Arctic.  His tires turn into skis.  He slaloms back and f between trees.  The Weasles pursue on dogsled. Benny grabs a striped barber's pole -- the North Pole -- slides down it.  They land in the Toon Sahara.  Benny cra up a large sand dune, his tongue hanging out of his radia He glances back at the Weasles who are mounted on camels, waving scimitars.  When they reach the top of the sand du we see they're on the precipice of a bottomless chasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the drawbridge -- we're gonna make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see any bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because you gotta draw it first. Benny takes a pencil hanging from a post lettered "Draw Bridge".  He wets the pencil point and in a flash draws a bridge.  It's a rickety rope bridge.  Using the pencil as balancing pole, Benny starts to tiptoe across. The Weasles jump off t'heir camels and start filing onto bridge after them. When Benny finally reaches the other side, Valiant grabs pencil from him and gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, come on. But Valiant stands facing the Weasles, who are charging a him, swords raised.  With a sly smile, Valiant holds up t eraser end of the pencil.  This freezes the Weasles.  But Valiant starts to erase a rope support, the eraser breaks the pencil and falls down into the chasm.  The Weasles WH with relief and advance for the kill.  At the last second Valiant takes the business end of the pencil and scribble handsaw.  He grabs it by the handle and saws the rope.  T bridge swings away, smacking the Weasles into the opposit canyon wall.  One by one, they slide off and disappear in the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: climbs back into Benny.  The Roadster takes off again, ma a skidding left turn onto the main drag.  As they make th break into the Toontown tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ten gallon drum is sitting by the side of the road unde the Toontown sign.  From in the tunnel we hear the SOUND Benny's ENGINE coming closer.  Now a foot comes out of th shadows and rests on the ten gallon drum.  As the SOUND o the ROADSTER gets VERY LOUD, the foot kicks the drum over spilling a clear liquid across the road.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOOT
dialogues.text: belongs to Judge Doom.  Doom smiles sadistically as the Roadster with Eddie and Jessica aboard comes shooting out the tunnel.  When Benny hits the liquid, he starts to ski

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh... whoaaa...!  Look out! His tires smoke, then disappear. It's a dip slick.  Witho tires, Benny spins out of control, finally ending up in t bushes roadside. Before Eddie and Jessica can make a move, they are surrou by a horde of Weasles pointing what looks like a hundred at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you two all right? Doom opens one of the Roadster's doors and helps Jessica Valiant climbs out after her.  The Weasles quickly reliev him of his Toon pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These roads can be very treacherous at night, especially in a maniacal Toon vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pot's callin' the kettle maniacal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had enough of your insolence! (to Weasles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him in my car.  I think they'll enjoy attending our ribbon cutting at the Acme factory. The Weasles prod Valiant and Jessica into Doom's Lincoln. Weasle refers to Benny WHIMPERING in the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going anywhere.  We'll send the mobile unit after him. Doom climbs into the car and it zooms off, Weasles jumpin onto the running boards.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: crawls out of the bushes on his axles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boinin', the boinin'... He makes it down into the drainage ditch, dipping his tootsies one by one.  There's a HISS as they hit the wate and the chemicals from the dip are extinguished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah... that's better. Now Benny hears the SOUND of another VEHICLE COMING out o the Toontown Tunnel.  He ducks down and peeks over the di to see...

dialogues.speaker: ROGER IN THE PACKARD
dialogues.text: come SCREAMING out of the tunnel backwards.  Maroon's Pac looks like the winner of a demolition derby. Benny stands and waves to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger! Roger sees him and slams on the brakes, skidding the Pack into the Toontown sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny? Benny hobbles over to the Packard.  He pops his trunk and rummages around.  He comes out with Toon boltcutters.  He clips Roger's cuffs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doom's got your wife and Valiant.  He took them to the Acme factory,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Benny nudges Roger to the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slide over, son.  It looks like you've done enough drivin' for tonight. Now the Toon Roadster gingerly gets behind the wheel of t Packard.  He hits the gas and the Packard lurches down th road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doom's car is parked inside.  There are several other vehicles as well.  There's a steamroller, a road grader, a huge modified tanker truck.  It's mounted with a thousa gallon vat, the contents of which are being stirred by a motorized unit.  All the vehicles are marked with a large green four-leaf clover logo.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT AND JESSICA
dialogues.text: are held at gunpoint by a couple of Weasles, while severa others are busy JACKHAMMERING the brick wall at the far e of the factory.  Doom pulls on his rubber gloves, turns t the Weasles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frisk them.  See if they have the will. Several Weasles rush for the opportunity to frisk Jessica The head Weasle slaps the others away.  Then WHEEZING laciviously, he turns to the task.  He starts to move his hands over her body when Jessica stomps her heel on his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands off me, you little rodent! The Weasle hops away angrily and quickly frisks Valiant. turns to Doom and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter. (checks watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't expect the will to show up in the next fifteen minutes.  By then Cloverleaf will own Toontown quite legally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're Cloverleaf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one person is Cloverleaf.  We're a vast company with diverse interests... gasoline, tires, automobiles.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BRICK WALL
dialogues.text: The jackhammering has stopped.  A Weasle plucks one brick of the wall.  Toon light beams through.  He reaches into hole in the wall and comes out holding a bunch of Toon bananas.  WHEEZING wickedly, he passes them out to his compatriots.  They devour the bananas, throwing the peels helter-skelter.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: turns his attention from the brick wall back to Doom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Doom.  What would a company like that want with Toontown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't Toontown they wanted.  It was my idea of how to put the land to better use. Doom goes to the truck and starts turning on valves and starting compressors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, they thought my concept so brilliant, that they offered me the Directorship of Transportation.  I've accepted. (to Weasle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me Mr. Valiant's gun. The Weasle trots over and delivers Valiant's Toon .38.  D inspects it.  He reads an engraving on the frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Thanks for getting me out of the hoosegow.  Yosemite Sam'. (looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How sweet. Doom throws the gun on the ground.  He pushes back a long lever on the truck, letting loose a tiny spurt of fluid f the discharge valve.  The gun disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  Enough to dip Toontown off the face of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: have been watching the proceedings through a window.  The turn to each other stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dip Toontown?
