dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta do something! Roger scurries back to the Packard hidden outside the gat He opens Valiant's black bag and comes out holding Eddie' real pistol.  Benny comes tenderfooting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, what're you gonna do with that gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna save them, of course.  You go for help.  Find Dolores at the Terminal Bar.  She'll know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... all right... Reluctantly, Benny gets behind the wheel of the Packard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you be careful now with that gun. This ain't no cartoon. Benny pulls away.  Roger turns with determination and zip back to the window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doom pulls the tarp off the top of the truck, revealing a modified water cannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sick, Doom.  Where do people like you come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind where I come from.  Just watch where I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think anyone's gonna notice that Toontown's gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't care.  Who's going to miss some ridiculous talking mice when they can have the future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is trying to jimmy open a window using his whole body for leverage.  He finally pops the window open.  Gun drawn, h climbs over the sill.  And falls head first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger splashes into the toilet bowl in the Acme washroom. bobs up.  He drains the water out of the pistol barrel an peeks over the bowl.  He gets a determined look in his ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to make my move. Roger starts to climb out of the toilet.  He reaches for something to grab onto.  Unwittingly, he gets the toilet chain hanging from the tank above.  As he pulls himself o the toilet flushes.   Roger has only a moment to register dumbfounded expression before he is sucked down the john.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FACTORY
dialogues.text: continues expansively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here where we're standing, will be the cornerstone of my idea... the cloverleaf -- an elegant cement structure that intertwines freeways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's a freeway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A freeway, Mr. Valiant, is eight lanes of asphalt running uninterrupted from L.A. to Pasadena.  Pasadena to Hollywood.  Hollywood to Santa Monica. Someday everyone will be in cars driving happily, non-stop from one end of the L.A. Basin to another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what this is all about?  Tell me, who's gonna use your lousy freeway? We got the Red Cars, the best public transportation in the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long.  We're retiring the Red Cars.  People will drive, Mr. Valiant, because they'll have to.  And when they drive, they'll have to buy our cars, our tires, our gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you bother to call it a freeway? Doom steps up into their faces.  Behind him, several Weas are fashioning a noose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has a nice ring.  Too bad you two won't be around to enjoy it. Suddenly Roger EXPLODES out of the drainage grate in the floor.  His entrance sends the Weasles flying.  Roger lan on his feet, James Cagney-like, levelling his gun on Judg Doom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get 'em up.  All of you!  Or I let the Judge have it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, darling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's me, my dearest.  I'd embrace you but first I have to take care of some unfinished business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put that gun down, you buck-toothed fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.  Give me an excuse to fill you full of holes, pump you full of lead. (over shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'm I doin', Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real good, Rog... but maybe you better let me take over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not before I satisfy my sense of moral outrage. Milking the moment, he shifts the gun from one hand to another.  He circles Doom, poking and prodding him with t gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you could get away with this? Hah!  We Toons may be idiotic, but we're not stupid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We LOOK DOWN on the proceedings from high in the rafters. PULL BACK TO REVEAL we're watching from the POV of Voltai who's perched on the top inventory rack.  Voltaire cleans fingernails, casually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, justice, Judge Doom.  The real meaning of the word probably hits you like a ton of bricks! Voltaire calmly nudges an Acme Ton-Of-Bricks off the shel

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: He never sees it coming.  SMASH!  The bricks land on his and bury him.  The only thing we can see of Roger is his with the gun in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is turning out better than I thought. Doom picks the gun up.  The Weasles drag Roger out from u the bricks.  Big bright stars are circling his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delirious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, stars!  Ready when you are, Raoul. Valiant shakes his head, but Jessica starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have missed you, Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie the lovebirds together. The Weasles twirl Toon rope around Roger and Jessica like cocoon.  They hook them on a power winch.  Then hit a but and raise Roger and Jessica until they're suspended fifte feet above the floor... right in the path of the Dipmobil Doom hands Valiant's gun to the head Weasle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him watch his Toon friends get dipped...  then shoot him. Doom turns and starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND
dialogues.text: He steps on a Toon banana peel and goes flat on his keest

dialogues.speaker: THE WEASLES
dialogues.text: always quick with a laugh, BREAK UP at their boss' misfortune.  The one guarding Eddie is so overcome with LAUGHTER that he's slapping his thigh with his gun hand. Valiant sees his opportunity.  He starts to make a move toward the distracted Weasle and almost gets his hands on gun when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out, you idiot... he's going for the gun! The Weasle turns at the last second, sticking the barrel against Valiant's nose.  Doom gets to his feet.  He glowe at the Weasle and knocks him on the head with the gavel h of his cane.  Doom stalks out of the room. The Weasles scramble to positions on the Dipmobile.  One FIRES UP the ENGINE. The streetcleaner brushes start to turn.  The vehicle sta to creep forward. Another Weasle climbs into the turret.  He puts Roger and Jessica in the crosshairs of the cannon. Beads of sweat break out on Valiant's face. The Weasle, WHEEZING with evil glee, starts to press his finger to the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys think this is real funny, doncha? (to Valiant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, do somethin'! At the last second, Eddie shouts at the Weasle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! The Weasle turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you pull the trigger, I want you to know somethin' about the guy you're about to dip. Suddenly, Eddie breaks into the "Looney Tooney Song".  Th song Roger had sung in the bar.  The silly voice that com out of his mouth surprises everybody, especially Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; sings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'His name is Roger Rabbit He's got a crazy habit...' Valiant starts skulking across the floor.  It's a cross between Groucho Marx and a Chuck Berry Duck Walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; sings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'He likes to sing and dance and yuk So brighten up and smile you schmuck...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valiant starts "hoo-hooing", slapping himself in the forehead.  Now the Weasles start GIGGLING.  They've never seen a human do this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Now my name's Eddie V I'm looney too you'll see' Valiant flips into a handstand and starts walking on his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I walk with my hands And I shake with my feet...' He offers his foot to a Weasle who shakes it.  The others HOWL.  Eddie flips upright and grabs a stick of Acme dynamite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I think dynamite Is swell to eat'. Eddie takes a bite out of the Toon dynamite and acts like he's savoring it.  The spectacle of this human doing this too much to bear.  Now the Weasles are rolling on the gro holding their sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lost his mind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, isn't it great?  Keep it up, Eddie... you're killing 'em, you're slayin' 'em, you're knockin' 'em dead. Roger means it.  The Weasles are laughing so hard they're giving themselves heart attacks.  Valiant spins around on floor like a clock dial gone berserk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoo-hoo-hoo-hoo... One by one, the Weasles keel over... dead.  Opaque WEASLE SPIRITS leave their bodies with wings and harps, and floa heavenward, still laughing.

dialogues.speaker: VOLTAIRE
dialogues.text: alarmed at the scene below, grabs a brick and flaps towar the ceiling.  He throws the brick through the skylight an flies out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doom!  Doom!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DIPMOBILE
dialogues.text: The Weasle on the turret collapses onto the trigger.  The unmanned dip cannon starts spraying, as the arm sweeps slowly back and forth like an, automatic lawn sprinkler.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: hitches a ride on the last ascending Weasle Spirit, letti it hoist him to the top of the truck.  As he moves the We body off the trigger...

dialogues.speaker: VOLTAIRE
dialogues.text: CRASHES back through the skylight and swoops down on Eddi He sinks his talons into Eddie's back and lifts him into air. As Valiant is being pulled skyward he reaches for somethi along the wall of inventory.  He grabs a handful of Acme Small Pills and jams a couple dowm the buzzard's mouth. Instantly, Voltaire starts to shrink.  As he gets smaller can no longer hold Eddie up.  They both descend as Voltai shrinks to the size of a chick. The sprayer is swinging back towards Roger and Jessica. the last second, Valiant reaches up and blocks it.  It sw back the other way. As Valiant scrambles up on the vehicle to turn it off, Voltaire has found a box of Acme Big Pills.  He pecks int it... and after a beat, EXPLODES out of the box.  He's no three times the size he was before.  Voltaire flaps in fo the kill. Valiant reaches the turret just in time to swing the cann around.  The spray of dip blasts one of Voltaire's wings He spins earthward like a flaming Messerschmidt, finally landing in the dip vat and dissolving into a black pool. Doom arrives just in time to see his pet bird dissolved. Angrily, he steps onto a giant Acme Mousetrap.  He uses a piece of Acme cheese to spring it, catapulting him throug the air. Just as Valiant is about to turn off the dip cannon, Doom lands on the truck.  He knocks Eddie off the turret with flying tackle.  They both hit the floor. Doom gets up, leaving Eddie stunned.  He sprints to where Weasle had dropped Eddie's pistol.  Finally Eddie shakes off.  He sees Doom about to reach the gun.  He straps on pair of Acme Rocket Skates, fires them up and shoots acro the floor.  He knocks Doom into a stack of Acme boxes, toppling the whole shelf down on top of him. As the sprayer swings back toward Roger and Jessica, they have their last moment together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, I want you to know I love you. I loved you more than any woman has ever loved a rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be comforted in the knowledge that as we face the Grim Dipper, our paint will be comingled for eternity. They both close their eyes, waiting for the end.  But it never cames.  The truck runs up on some boxes and the spr arm swings back the other way. Doom grabs an Acme slingshot, loads an Acme boulder and f it at Valiant.  BLAM!  It whacks Valiant on the head, lay him out cold in front of the Cloverleaf steamroller, Doom climbs into the steamroller and starts it up.  He pu it into gear and starts it rolling toward Valiant. Valiant comes around to see the huge roller bearing down him.  At the last second, Valiant rolls out of the way an grabs an Acme boxing glove.  It accordians out and smashe Doom in the face.  He goes flying out of the driver's sea turning the wheel as he falls.  The steamroller starts to turn in circles. Valiant jumps Doom.  But Doom is stronger.  He throws Val off and starts whacking him with his fist.  He pummels Valiant backward toward the drum of the steamroller.  Val grabs the nearest thing for defense.  It's a can of Acme Stay-Put Adhesive.  He whips it up in front of his face. Doom puts his fist right through it, covering his hand wi glue.  He smiles at Valiant and hauls off again.  Valiant ducks.  Doom's fist strikes the top of the drum of the steamroller.  Frantically he tries to pull it off.  But i "Stays-Put".  The roller starts to suck his fist down and under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooo! Jessica and Roger avert their eyes as the steamroller cru Doom. Valiant breathes a sigh of relief.  He starts for the dip truck as the cannon swings back toward Roger and Jessica. But neither of them are watching the cannon.  Their eyes fixed on the ground behind the steamroller.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND
dialogues.text: There isn't the messy pile of blood and guts you'd expect see if a human got run over.  Instead, we see that Judge Doom's remains have rolled out like a flat black pancake. After a beat, an edge curls up with a CREAK.  Now the who shape peels off the floor and wobbles to it's feet. REVEA DOOM IS A TOON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, look out!

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: turns to see Doom stick his flattened thumb in his mouth. blows, re-inflating himself.  His glasses CRACK and fall Then his prosthetic eyeballs pop out.  His teeth shatter fall out of his mouth like china.  Underneath his latex m we can see his Toon mouth and evil red Toon eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, he's a Toon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.  Only a Toon could think of something as goofy as that freeway idea. Doom takes the black rubber gloves off, REVEALING red han with long fingernails.  He makes his fist into an anvil a advances on Valiant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so?  Well, we'll see who's the goofy one. BLAM!  From ten feet away, he smashes Valiant with a bone-crushing punch.  Valiant staggers backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, when I killed your brother, Teddy, I used to talk just like this. Doom spesks in a Toony high-pitched squeak.  Valiant recognizes him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, me. BLAM!  Doom hammers Valiant again.  He's defenseless agai Doom's super human strength.  BLAM!  Valiant goes sprawling to the ground.  Now Doom's hand turns into a buzzsaw.  He goes to administer the coup de grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Eddie's gonna be deady, just like Teddy. With his last ounce of strength, Valiant grabs the Acme Boxing Glove.  He pops it.  The glove extends across the room, punching the release lever on the dip truck.

dialogues.speaker: VALVE
dialogues.text: A flood of dip gushes out of the valve and rolls toward D like a wave.

dialogues.speaker: DOOM
dialogues.text: SCREAMS as the torrent hits him with a CRASH.  But there' escape for him this time.  The flood of liquid envelopes at the ankles.  He dissolves into it like a melting candl

dialogues.speaker: THE DIPMOBILE
dialogues.text: continues forward inexorably.  The arm is swinging toward Roger and Jessica.  It gets closer and closer... Valiant tries to get to the truck, but it's too late.  Th cannon has reached them.

dialogues.speaker: ROGER AND JESSICA
dialogues.text: They close their eyes, preparing to meet their Maker.  Bu nothing happens. The spray of the cannon suddenly peters out.  It dries up a harmless drip as the tank has completely emptied. Valiant gets to the controls of the power winch.  He hois Roger and Jessica up out of the way.  The Dipmobile passe harmlessly underneath them and SMASHES through the brick wall.

dialogues.speaker: TOONTOWN
dialogues.text: is REVEALED in all its splendor.  It's a bucolic setting. rainbow shares the blue sky with a smiling sun.  Fawns an butterflies, chipmunks and flowers watch curiously as the truck rolls past.  Suddenly it's lifted off the ground. see it's resting on the top of a TOON GIANT's head.  This Giant plucks the truck off his head, regards it, then pop in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: VALIANT
dialogues.text: lowers Roger and Jessica to the ground.  We HEAR POLICE SIRENS approach.  When Valiant unties them, Jessica turns exclaims...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hero! Then she hugs Roger passionately.  Valiant can only shrug

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WALL
dialogues.text: start coming in.  They look around at the scene, bewilder then gather around Doom's robe, mask and shoes lying in t puddle of dip.  There's a reddish slick floating on top. Valiant wanders over and joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi-ho, the Doom is dead.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: Dolores, Lt. Santino, and several other COPS rush in, gun drawn.  Dolores runs to Eddie and puts her arms around hi Santino looks down at the remains on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... that was the Judge? Valiant takes the paint chip out of his pocket.  He puts up against the red slime on the robe.  It's a match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the murderer of Herman Acme, Maroon... and my brother. Dolores looks down at the front of Valiant's shirt.  A da stain is appearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, we better get you to hospital. You're bleedin'. Valiant looks down at the stain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not blood.  That's ink.  That goof Acme squirted me with some the other day.  Why it's comin' 'through now, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because it's Disappearing-Reappearing Ink.  Shows up three days later.  Gives you enough time to get away from the victim so he doesn't punch you in the nose.  Great gag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll treat you to a new shirt.  After all, you did save Toontown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem is without Marvin's will, the land still goes to Cloverleaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  If only we knew what happened to that will... Valiant looks up from his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say Roger, remember that love letter you wrote your wife at the Ink & Paint Club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you oughta read it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea. He reaches in his pocket, pulls out the paper and clears throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Jessy... How do I love thee?  Let me count the... I, Marvin Acme, of sound mind and body... Hey?

dialogues.speaker: PAPER
dialogues.text: The Disappearing-Reappearing Ink is coming up over Roger' scribbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep reading...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's the will.  I, Marvin Acme, of sound mind and body, hoo-hoo-hoo-hoo, do hereby bequeath in perpetuity the property known as Toontown to those loveable characters... PAN the Toon crowd, who are listening to the reading of t will.  It is a gallery of recognizable faces.  Everyone f Mickey to Bugs, Yakky Doodle to Yosemite Sam, Dumbo to Do Bambi to Droopy, Tweety Bird to Tinkerbell.  They're all there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... who have given me and the rest of humanity so much mirth and merriment... the Toons. The Toon crowd erupts with a CHEER!  Hats go in the air a they descend on Roger, slapping his back.  Roger breaks a from the crowd and joins Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND ROGER
dialogues.text: They stand side by side, looking out over Toontown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Eddie, you still think I'm a patsy, a simp, a chump? Eddie wipes the spit off his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, kid, you're a real hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I am at that.  Cigar? Roger holds out a large stogie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Roger lights Eddie's and one for himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, Roger, you were right about your wife.  She's a good lady.  I'm glad you got her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm glad you got your sense of humor back.  Think you'll keep it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only time will tell. Valiant puffs on the cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good cigar.  Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From this box here... Valiant glances down.  The box says, "Acme Exploding Ciga He looks to Roger, but it's too late.  KABOOM!  KABOOM! Their cigars blow up in classic Toon tradition, blackenin both their faces.  Roger starts laughing.  Eddie stares a Roger for a moment, then he starts laughing too.  They th their heads back in a HOWL.  The other Toons join in.  Pr soon the whole factory is shaking with LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: A TOON COP
dialogues.text: dressed in blue uniform and hat with his back to us tries restore order in the Acme factory.  As soon as he talks, recognize the stutter.  It's PORKY PIG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O-k-k-k, mmmove along.  There's nnnothin' else to see.  T-t-that's it. T-t-that's all, folks. (turns to CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm, I l-l-like the sound of that. Then, savoring the phrase, Porky stutters out the famous sign-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eee-ba-da, eee-ba-da... t-t-that's all, folks! CARTOON MUSIC UP.
